camps.title: Brazilian Soccer Camp (7-14yrs)
camps.description: Brazilian United Soccer provides experienced international coaches who specialize in unique player development. Kids will enhance their skills through technical, tactical, and small-sided games in a safe, enjoyable environment. Tailored to various age groups and skill levels, the #BeyondSoccer approach, combined with authentic Brazilian soccer techniques, offers transformative experiences.

camps.title: Drone Code: Programming with Python 3 (9-14 yrs)
camps.description: Campers will explore the basics of flight mechanics and aerodynamics while learning how drones take to the skies with iCODE. They'll use beginner-friendly Python coding to program flight patterns, then put their skills to the test by navigating obstacle courses. Along the way, campers will build critical thinking and quick decision-making skills.

camps.title: Donut Shop Art (5-12 yrs)
camps.description: Step into the Kidcreate Donut Shop, where creativity smells as sweet as it looks. Using clay and paint, campers will craft scented donuts topped with whimsical cotton candy or maple bacon details.

camps.title: Bricking Fun LEGO® Engineering Jr (6-8yrs)
camps.description: Dive headfirst into the world of simple machines with Snapology. Construct, tinker, and explore the hidden mechanics that make everyday objects work. From gears and pulleys to levers and inclined planes, uncover the secrets behind the LEGO® creations you love and unleash your inner engineer.

camps.title: Books for Cooks Camp (6-10 yrs)
camps.description: Tiny Chefs stirs up Storytime in this deliciously creative camp. Inspired by beloved books like If You Give a Moose a Muffin and Dragons Love Tacos, young chefs will bring their favorite stories to life through hands-on cooking adventures. Tiny Chefs reviews products for allergy warnings indicated on the label. Tiny Chefs is not liable for allergens not listed on the label.

camps.title: Books for Cooks Camp (6-10 yrs)
camps.description: Tiny Chefs stirs up Storytime in this deliciously creative camp. Inspired by beloved books like If You Give a Moose a Muffin and Dragons Love Tacos, young chefs will bring their favorite stories to life through hands-on cooking adventures. Tiny Chefs reviews products for allergy warnings indicated on the label. Tiny Chefs is not liable for allergens not listed on the label.

camps.title: Roblox Obby Masters Camp (8-12 yrs)
camps.description: Campers dive into the world of Roblox by designing and coding their own obstacle course. In the morning, they'll learn how obbies work, spawns, final rooms and damaging blocks. In the afternoon, they'll bring their creativity to life by building their ultimate obby. iCode provides secure, locked-down Roblox accounts to ensure a safe experience for all campers.

camps.title: Basketball & Sports MiniCamp (6-12 yrs)
camps.description: Join One on One where participants will focus on basketball in the morning and then are introduced to a variety of sports after lunch including soccer, kickball and capture the flag. Rec Center camps include an afternoon swim break.

camps.title: Coding with Fun & Robot Fun (6-12 yrs)
camps.description: Stemtree campers will code in either Python or Scratch based on their grade levels. Scratch is a highly visual programming language suitable for younger students. Python is one of the most popular programming languages used in data sciences and machine learning. Robots inspire campers to learn engineering, apply basic science, model construction, computer programming, problem-solving skills and knowledge to explore STEM concepts.

camps.title: Wind & Wings Camp (6-13 yrs)
camps.description: A day of movement-inspired crafts like windsocks, kites, birds, and fluttery creations that celebrate breezy spring skies.

camps.title: STEAMCRAFT: Minecraft Science (6-12yrs)
camps.description: Campers will bring to life many of the in-game Minecraft experiences using science. From Creeper slime to item enchantments, participants will put on lab coats and dissect the world of Minecraft.

camps.title: Splish, Splash Fish Camp (5 1/2-12 yrs)
camps.description: Dive into art with Abrakadoodle designing fish signs, create colorful tropical sea creatures, and other underwater friends.

camps.title: Splish, Splash Fish Camp (5 1/2-12 yrs)
camps.description: Dive into art with Abrakadoodle designing fish signs, create colorful tropical sea creatures, and other underwater friends.

camps.title: Splish, Splash Fish Camp (5 1/2-12 yrs)
camps.description: Dive into art with Abrakadoodle designing fish signs, create colorful tropical sea creatures, and other underwater friends.

camps.title: Splish, Splash Fish Camp (5 1/2-12 yrs)
camps.description: Dive into art with Abrakadoodle designing fish signs, create colorful tropical sea creatures, and other underwater friends.

camps.title: Chess Camp (6-13yrs)
camps.description: This Silver Knights camp has taught the great strategy game to more than 100,000 children including national champions. This camp is for advanced players to sharpen their skills or beginners who want to learn the game. Campers will learn the rules, openings, tactics, strategy, endgames, while playing games and taking outdoor breaks.

camps.title: Chess Camp (6-13yrs)
camps.description: This Silver Knights camp has taught the great strategy game to more than 100,000 children including national champions. This camp is for advanced players to sharpen their skills or beginners who want to learn the game. Campers will learn the rules, openings, tactics, strategy, endgames, while playing games and taking outdoor breaks.

camps.title: B2R Rock Band Camp (7-15yrs)
camps.description: Practice and perform as part of a real rock band on the instrument of your choice. Bands receive coaching from professional musicians to learn, record, and perform at least two songs by the end of the week. Depending on the skill level of the students, bands are encouraged to write their own songs or pick from our 400+ popular arrangements. No music experience required.

camps.title: B2R Rock Band Camp (7-15yrs)
camps.description: Practice and perform as part of a real rock band on the instrument of your choice. Bands receive coaching from professional musicians to learn, record, and perform at least two songs by the end of the week. Depending on the skill level of the students, bands are encouraged to write their own songs or pick from our 400+ popular arrangements. No music experience required.

camps.title: Stay Cool Ice-Skating (6-13yr)-spring
camps.description: Beat the heat and improve your ice-skating skills. Enjoy a daily, on-ice lesson, free skate time, on-ice games, and activities. Direct on-ice time is 1.5-2 hours. Camp includes free use of rental skates and five additional practice sessions. Previous skating experience (Basic 1 level) required. Campers also enjoy off ice activities. Bring snack, lunch and drink.

camps.title: ACTion! Acting Adventures (7-14yrs)
camps.description: In this Moonlit Wings Camp, campers take the spotlight with original scenes, improv games, and character-building activities inspired by favorite films and plays. Campers explore short skits, musical moments while sharpening creativity, collaboration, and on-your-feet thinking. All experience levels welcome. Bring swimsuit/towel for afternoon swim break.

camps.title: STEAM Art - DIY Kaleidoscope (5-12yrs)
camps.description: Explore the magic of light and reflection with Kidcreate. Campers will build their own kaleidoscope, uncovering the science behind dazzling patterns. It's a hands-on adventure in art, science, and imagination.

camps.title: Bricking Fun LEGO® Robotics Jr.  (6-8yrs)
camps.description: In this exciting Snapology robotics workshop, campers build a Rover Bot that responds to color and a Surgeon Bot that can be controlled using buttons. They'll learn the fundamentals of robotic movement, sensing, and programming as they bring their creations to life.

camps.title: LEGO® SPIKE™ Robotics: Amazing Amusement Park
camps.description: Campers will design and code amusement park thematic rides using LEGO® SPIKE™ kits. Tackle projects like building ferris wheels and carousels, while learning STEAM foundations. Each project enhances computational thinking, sequence creation, and problem-solving skills.

camps.title: Eat What You Grow (6-10 yrs)-sp
camps.description: History is messy and delicious. Help us start the kitchen garden and learn how the people of Colvin Run relied on plants for food, medicine, and housekeeping. Bring home a starter garden and a garden treat.

camps.title: Basketball Camp (6-14 yrs)
camps.description: Campers will learn the game of basketball and improve their basketball skills. Moves, scrimmages and 1v1's are fundamentals of this camp.

camps.title: Potion & Lotion Lab (6-10 yrs)
camps.description: Dive into the science of self-care with SciGenie. Campers will explore how everyday beauty and bath products are made while mixing their own lotions, perfumes, and bubbly potions. Using natural ingredients and chemistry experiments, they'll learn how cosmetic scientists blend creativity with science to design safe, effective products. A perfect mix of imagination, innovation, and hands-on discovery.

camps.title: Ultimate Music Experience MiniCamp (5-12 yr)
camps.description: Learn Now Music introduces campers to a variety of musical instruments and concepts including piano, guitar, violin, drums, voice, and movement. Campers participate in games, crafts, listening excerpts, and related projects. FREE instrument rentals are provided for in-camp use (LNMG Camp Form must be signed). Bring lunch, snacks, and a drink daily (no nuts).

camps.title: Ultimate Music Experience MiniCamp (5-12 yr)
camps.description: Learn Now Music introduces campers to a variety of musical instruments and concepts including piano, guitar, violin, drums, voice, and movement. Campers participate in games, crafts, listening excerpts, and related projects. FREE instrument rentals are provided for in-camp use (LNMG Camp Form must be signed). Bring lunch, snacks, and a drink daily (no nuts).

camps.title: Rock City World Tour (4-7yrs)
camps.description: Learn core musical concepts, like loud and soft, fast and slow, and high and low notes through movement-based activities. Children receive hands-on experience with a variety of instruments while learning fundamental skills to prepare them for future music lessons.

camps.title: Create Academy (5-12 yrs)
camps.description: Campers will create their own clay paintbrush, craft a vibrant rainbow with oil pastels, watercolor paint and yarn, explore the art of printmaking, and make an adorable hedgehog out of clay. This Kidcreate camp sparks creativity, encourages hands-on exploration, and inspires endless imaginative adventures.

camps.title: Kiddie Camp (3-5 yrs.)
camps.description: Preschoolers will participate in a variety of activities including music, movement, arts and crafts, outdoor games, water play and a special event.

camps.title: Foundational Skills Soccer Camp (6-12yrs)
camps.description: Challenger Sports team of international and US-based staff helps improve your camper's technical foundational skills while providing a unique cultural experience. Rooted in British training methodology, this curriculum and coaching foundation meets engaging delivery for an all-around positive experience. Soccer ball and Jersey Included. Sign up to host a coach and receive a free week on camp.

camps.title: Brazilian Soccer Camp (7-14yrs)
camps.description: Brazilian United Soccer provides experienced international coaches who specialize in unique player development. Kids will enhance their skills through technical, tactical, and small-sided games in a safe, enjoyable environment. Tailored to various age groups and skill levels, the #BeyondSoccer approach, combined with authentic Brazilian soccer techniques, offers transformative experiences.

camps.title: Mini-Hawk Sports Camp (4-6 yrs)
camps.description: Multi-sport program designed to give children a positive first step into athletics. Through exciting games and activities, campers explore balance, hand/eye coordination, and skill development at their own pace. Every camper receives an award certificate and Skyhawks t-shirt.

camps.title: Mini-Hawk Sports Camp (4-6 yrs)
camps.description: Multi-sport program designed to give children a positive first step into athletics. Through exciting games and activities, campers explore balance, hand/eye coordination, and skill development at their own pace. Every camper receives an award certificate and Skyhawks t-shirt.

camps.title: Fencing Camp w/Fairfax Fencers (7-15yrs)
camps.description: In this action-packed camp, campers will learn etiquette and fencing safety of all three Olympics fencing disciplines (foil, epee and saber). Show off your skills at the end-of-the-week camp tournament. Contact Fairfax Fencers about before and after care.

camps.title: Basketball & Swim Camp (6-14 yrs)
camps.description: Join One on One Basketball for a day of drills, contests, and games before taking an afternoon swim break.

camps.title: World Cup Soccer Camp (6-14 yrs)
camps.description: Channels global excitement into unforgettable summer camp. Campers won't just play soccer—they'll celebrate it. Through fast-paced drills, creative skill challenges, and daily scrimmages, campers build confidence, teamwork, and lasting friendships. Each week features World Cup-themed games, country flag days, and mini-tournaments that bring the international spirit to life.

camps.title: World Cup Soccer Camp (6-14 yrs)
camps.description: Channels global excitement into unforgettable summer camp. Campers won't just play soccer—they'll celebrate it. Through fast-paced drills, creative skill challenges, and daily scrimmages, campers build confidence, teamwork, and lasting friendships. Each week features World Cup-themed games, country flag days, and mini-tournaments that bring the international spirit to life.

camps.title: Bricking Fun LEGO Engineering (8-12yrs)
camps.description: Dive headfirst into the world of simple machines. Construct, tinker, and explore the hidden mechanics that make everyday objects work. From gears and pulleys to levers and inclined planes, uncover the secrets behind LEGO® creations and unleash your inner engineer.

camps.title: Hoops & More: Basketball & Tennis (6-12 yrs)
camps.description: Players learn the fundamentals of basketball and tennis with JST. Camp includes confidence-building drills and matches incorporating skills learned. Activities include dribble tag, hot-seat and ultimate knockout. Bring racket, lunch, drink and swimsuit/towel for an afternoon swim break.

camps.title: All Sports Camp (6 1/2-12 1/2 yrs)
camps.description: Learn the fundamentals of multiple sports including football, volleyball, soccer, baseball, track and lacrosse with Alpha Sports. Campers are grouped by age and enjoy participating in scrimmages and tournaments.

camps.title: Softball Camp with US9 (7-13 yrs)-sp
camps.description: US9 staff teach both fundamentals and advanced skills. Campers enjoy daily scrimmages, trivia contests, and instruction on pitching, hitting, baserunning, fielding, strategy, and sportsmanship. Camp includes afternoon swim break.

camps.title: Softball Camp with US9 (7-13 yrs)-sp
camps.description: US9 staff teach both fundamentals and advanced skills. Campers enjoy daily scrimmages, trivia contests, and instruction on pitching, hitting, baserunning, fielding, strategy, and sportsmanship. Camp includes afternoon swim break.

camps.title: Battle of the Bots (7-10 yrs)
camps.description: Campers dive into the fascinating world of VEX robotics and hardware, experiencing the thrill of designing, building, programming, and controlling their very own battle-bot with iCODE instructors.

camps.title: Budding Artists Camp (6-13 yrs)
camps.description: Campers will explore the colorful world of art through playful, nature-inspired projects. From painting blooming flowers and designing butterfly collages to sculpting garden creatures and decorating vibrant pots, every day is a chance to grow their imagination and let their inner artist blossom.

camps.title: Forces of Nature (6-12yrs)-sp
camps.description: Plants, animals and sun are all forces in nature. Through experiments, campers will learn how weather impacts the earth, the role plants play as a natural force, and what animals change to their environment.

camps.title: Spring into Nature (7-10 yrs.)
camps.description: Enter places seldom seen as you explore hidden woodland, stream and pond habitats. Campers will participate in aquatic life investigations and explore animal architecture.

camps.title: ACTion! Pop Star Spotlight (7-14 yrs) - spring
camps.description: In this Moonlit Wings camp, kids take center stage to star in original scenes and sing and dance to popular radio hits by today's pop stars and legendary icons. Campers also explore improvisation games, character creation and a talent show while building imagination, storytelling skills, and teamwork. All experience levels welcome. Sessions that meet for five days will conclude with a mini performance for family and friends on Friday. Bring swimsuit/towel for afternoon swim break.

camps.title: ACTion! Pop Star Spotlight (7-14 yrs) - spring
camps.description: In this Moonlit Wings camp, kids take center stage to star in original scenes and sing and dance to popular radio hits by today's pop stars and legendary icons. Campers also explore improvisation games, character creation and a talent show while building imagination, storytelling skills, and teamwork. All experience levels welcome. Sessions that meet for five days will conclude with a mini performance for family and friends on Friday. Bring swimsuit/towel for afternoon swim break.

camps.title: Travel Mountain Biking Camp (9-14yrs)
camps.description: Exhilarating week-long camp for young riders eager to master mountain biking. From foundational skills to tackling intermediate challenges, campers receive comprehensive instruction on steering, shifting, hill climbing and descending, obstacle negotiation, trail etiquette, bike maintenance, and safety.

camps.title: Travel Mountain Biking Camp (9-14yrs)
camps.description: Exhilarating week-long camp for young riders eager to master mountain biking. From foundational skills to tackling intermediate challenges, campers receive comprehensive instruction on steering, shifting, hill climbing and descending, obstacle negotiation, trail etiquette, bike maintenance, and safety.

camps.title: Travel Mountain Biking Camp (9-14yrs)
camps.description: Exhilarating week-long camp for young riders eager to master mountain biking. From foundational skills to tackling intermediate challenges, campers receive comprehensive instruction on steering, shifting, hill climbing and descending, obstacle negotiation, trail etiquette, bike maintenance, and safety.

camps.title: Circus Arts & Balloon Sculptures (6-12yrs)
camps.description: Spirit Pros brings circus excitement to life with juggling, balance stunts, and balloon twisting into animals and wild creations. Campers try new skills in a playful setting, discovering that anyone can step into the spotlight. The week is packed with energy, laughter, and the thrill of performing something brand new.

camps.title: B2R Beat Making Camp (8-15ytrs.)-sp
camps.description: Discover the world of DJing and music production. Learn how to make your own beats and craft songs through loop, beats and samples on the popular music production program, BandLab.

camps.title: All About Me: Creation Art Camp (5-12yrs)
camps.description: Join Kidcreate instructors to make art inspired by all your favorite things. Get messy with many different types of art materials, such as paint and clay, while learning basic art concepts and techniques. These projects will journal your camper's world and everything they love right now.

camps.title: Bricking Fun LEGO® Robotics (8-12 yrs)
camps.description: Design, build, and program your own LEGO® creations that come to life with Snapology. Unlock the secrets of sensors, motors, and coding as you transform simple bricks into intelligent, programmable robots. Problem-solve, experiment, and unleash your inner techno-wizard as you bring your masterpieces to life.

camps.title: Fiesta Kitchen (6-10 yrs)
camps.description: Tiny Chefs will explore the bold and vibrant tastes of Mexican and Southwestern cuisine while learning real kitchen skills. From mixing to rolling to sizzling, this camp is full of flavor and festive culinary creativity.

camps.title: Fiesta Kitchen (6-10 yrs)
camps.description: Tiny Chefs will explore the bold and vibrant tastes of Mexican and Southwestern cuisine while learning real kitchen skills. From mixing to rolling to sizzling, this camp is full of flavor and festive culinary creativity.

camps.title: Lakeside Nature Discovery Spring Camp (7-10yrs)
camps.description: Campers enjoy guided nature hikes, crafts and fishing. Shaded trails and lakefronts are perfect settings for exploring creatures and plants that live in streams, lakes and forests. Bring lunch, snack and water bottle. Meets at the large shelter by marina. Camps run rain or shine. Contact park for details on extreme weather days.

camps.title: Soccer Camp (6-12yrs)
camps.description: Games using soccer skills that progress to small-sided soccer. As the week progresses, games involve different moves, dribbling, ball control, passing, and shooting. Games require individual 1-on-1 skills with some requiring team participation.

camps.title: Baseball Camp with US9 (7-12 yr)
camps.description: This US9 camp teaches both fundamentals and advanced skills. Campers enjoy daily scrimmages, trivia contests and instruction on pitching, hitting, baserunning, fielding, strategy and sportsmanship. Camps include afternoon swim break.

camps.title: Baseball Camp with US9 (7-12 yr)
camps.description: This US9 camp teaches both fundamentals and advanced skills. Campers enjoy daily scrimmages, trivia contests and instruction on pitching, hitting, baserunning, fielding, strategy and sportsmanship. Camps include afternoon swim break.

camps.title: Magical World of Dance (4-7 yrs)
camps.description: Join Art in Motion for a magical week of dance with your favorite characters from around the world. Twirl with Elsa and Anna in Arendale, dance under the sea with Ariel and Sebastian, or take a "ride" on a magic carpet with Aladdin and Jasmine.

camps.title: Animals: Zoology Fun (6-11 yrs)-sp
camps.description: Explore the woods, creeks and ponds as we look for all sorts of critters. Learn about the animal life science of frogs, toads, birds, mammals, snakes, turtles, fish and insects through hikes, projects and games.

camps.title: Spring Break on the Farm (6-10 yrs)
camps.description: Look for the new baby animals on the farm indoors and out. The day includes arts and crafts, hikes, farm visits, and field games. This Katydidkids camp meets at the Old Floris Schoolhouse.

camps.title: Chess Camp (6-13yrs)
camps.description: This Silver Knights camp has taught the great strategy game to more than 100,000 children including national champions. This camp is for advanced players to sharpen their skills or beginners who want to learn the game. Campers will learn the rules, openings, tactics, strategy, endgames, while playing games and taking outdoor breaks. Bring a lunch, snack, and drink. Campers will receive a t-shirt and chess set on Friday.

camps.title: Stem & Play: Multi-Sport Camp (7-12 yrs)
camps.description: Combines strategic STEM-based activities with traditional Skyhawks sports instruction and a focus on life skills such as teamwork and sportsmanship. The STEM Sports® curriculum allows campers to explore the sports they love with modules centered around technology, science, and innovation. Subjects include ball design, calculating distances and angles, velocity, and acceleration. Campers learn fundamentals through skill-based drills and scrimmages. Every camper receives an award certificate and Skyhawks t-shirt.

camps.title: Paper Crafts Camp (6-14 yrs)
camps.description: Dive into the colorful world of paper art, from folding origami creations to designing decorative papier-mâché masks and crafting stunning mock stained glass. This camp is all about turning simple paper into amazing works of art.

camps.title: Creative Skills Soccer Camp (6-13yrs)
camps.description: In this Challenger Sports camp with inflatable fields, music and International coaches, campers use the street skills that lie in the heart of all great soccer players. This accelerates a player's learning and assists them to produce better performance on the field. This program goes beyond technical skills and focuses on the psychological and philosophical combined aspects to create an atmosphere which fosters creative player development. Sign up to host a coach and receive a free week on camp.

camps.title: Master Artist Cartoon Camp (5 1/2-12 yrs)
camps.description: Join Abrakadoodle to draw cartoons inspired by artists and their styles. Experience character invention, illustration, portraits, shading and patterns.

camps.title: Master Artist Cartoon Camp (5 1/2-12 yrs)
camps.description: Join Abrakadoodle to draw cartoons inspired by artists and their styles. Experience character invention, illustration, portraits, shading and patterns.

camps.description: Join Abrakadoodle to draw cartoons inspired by artists and their styles. Experience character invention, illustration, portraits, shading and patterns.

Depending on the skill level of the students, bands are encouraged to write their own songs or pick from our 400+ popular arrangements. No music experience required.

camps.title: Tennis with JST (6-12 yrs)
camps.description: Outdoor tennis instruction through drills and games that help improve skills.

camps.title: Multi-Sport Camp (6-11 yrs)
camps.description: Skyhawks Athletes learn the rules and essential skills of each sport, along with vital life lessons such as sportsmanship, inclusion, and teamwork. Every child receives an award certificate and Skyhawks t-shirt.

camps.title: Gamer Adventures (6-12yrs)
camps.description: Learn the fundamentals of programming, art and level design to create a video game from the ground up with Stem exCEL. Using a game engine with integrated art software and an easy-to-use events system, campers have the freedom to create a product that is truly their own. Learn about the history of video games by playing classic ones to see the advancement of technology. Campers leave with a digital copy of their work.

camps.title: Humans Inside & Out (5-8yrs)
camps.description: Learn all about humans with The Science Seed staff. Campers will explore our senses, skin, body systems and organs. Discover why we have bones and what the nervous system does. Find out how germs get inside the body. Other activities include outdoor recess, a science-related story time and a daily journal entry.

camps.title: Stay Cool Ice-Skating (6-13yr)-spring
camps.description: Beat the heat and improve your ice-skating skills. Enjoy a daily, on-ice lesson, free skate time, on-ice games, and activities. Direct on-ice time is 1.5-2 hours. Camp includes free use of rental skates and five additional practice sessions. Previous skating experience (Basic 1 level) required. Campers also enjoy off-ice activities.

camps.title: Explore Science & Robo Fun (6-12 yrs)
camps.description: Robots inspire campers to learn engineering and apply their basic science, model construction, computer programming, problem-solving skills, and knowledge to explore STEM concepts. Spark curiosity and deepen appreciation for science through engaging and hands-on learning experiences. Stemtree curriculum empowers campers to become confident scientific thinkers by exploring the core principles of science. Previous participants will continue learning new concepts.

camps.title: Sew Sweet: Donut & Cookie Pillow Making (8-12yrs)
camps.description: Boys and girls will learn basic hand and machine techniques, measuring, using patterns, fabric structure, maintenance and sewing machine operation. Design and decorate your favorite donut or cookie out of fleece to make a pillow.

camps.title: YouTube Creator: Learn Production Basics (8-12y)
camps.description: YouTube is the go-to platform for creators to share content. With iCODE, learn the essentials of filming, editing, and producing engaging videos. Campers will get hands-on experience with digital cameras, audio and video editing, and discover how to make content stand out and connect with an audience.

camps.title: Camp Riverbend (6-9 yrs)
camps.description: In this week-long outdoor sampler, campers will participate in rock climbing, meeting exhibit animals, fishing, hiking, exploring wildlife and taking a park wagon ride. Different themes each day teach primitive skills while enjoying outdoor recreation and a campfire cookout.

camps.title: Beading & Wire Wrapping Camp (6-14yrs)
camps.description: Unleash your creativity in this hands-on jewelry-making camp. Explore the colorful world of beads and learn the art of wire wrapping to create unique, one-of-a-kind accessories. Design and craft dazzling bracelets, artistic pendants, and other wearable masterpieces. Perfect for beginners and budding jewelry artists.

camps.title: Beading & Wire Wrapping Camp (6-14yrs)

camps.description: Campers explore the world of robotics as they build moving animals that teach the fundamentals of robotic design with Snapology. Whether learning about animal habitats or discovering ways that gears and pulleys create movement while building dancing birds and robotic dogs, your child is sure to have a great time.

camps.title: Basketball & Pickleball Camp (6-12 yrs)
camps.description: This camp will focus on fundamentals and skills in both basketball and pickleball with One on One coaches. Campers will participate in drills and contests before playing daily games in each sport. The program will culminate with championship games. Bring a swimsuit/towel for afternoon pool time if available.

camps.title: Ultimate Music Experience MiniCamp (5-12 yr)
camps.description: Learn Now Music introduces campers to a variety of musical instruments and concepts including piano, guitar, violin, drums, voice, and movement. Campers participate in games, crafts, listening excerpts, and related projects. FREE instrument rentals are provided for in-camp use (LNMG Camp Form must be signed). Bring lunch, snacks, and a drink daily (no nuts).

camps.title: Baseball Beginners Camp (5-6yrs)
camps.description: This US9 camp will introduce skills such as throwing, catching, fielding, hitting and baserunning. Camp consists of attention-grabbing, short sessions of skill-related activities using batting drills, safety balls, bean bags and targets.

camps.title: Baseball Beginners Camp (5-6yrs)
camps.description: This US9 camp will introduce skills such as throwing, catching, fielding, hitting and baserunning. Camp consists of attention-grabbing, short sessions of skill-related activities using batting drills, safety balls, bean bags and targets.

camps.title: Rock City World Tour (4-7yrs)
camps.description: Learn core musical concepts, like loud and soft, fast and slow, and high and low notes through movement-based activities. Children receive hands-on experience with a variety of instruments while learning fundamental skills to prepare them for future music lessons.

camps.title: Bricking Fun: Sensory Friendly LEGO® Robotics
camps.description: With Snapology robotics, campers build a Rover Bot that responds to color and a Surgeon Bot that can be controlled using buttons. Learn the fundamentals of robotic movement, sensing, and programming as you bring creations to life.

camps.title: Bricking Fun: Sensory Friendly LEGO® Engineering
camps.description: In this hands-on Snapology LEGO® camp, dive headfirst into the world of simple machines. Construct, tinker, and explore the hidden mechanics that make everyday objects work. From gears and pulleys to levers and inclined planes, uncover the secrets behind LEGO® creations and unleash your inner engineer.

camps.title: All About Animals (3.5-6 yrs)
camps.description: Katydid Kids camp based at the Old Floris Schoolhouse, includes daily farm visits. Learn facts and stories about animals through indoor and outdoor games, songs, and puppetry.

camps.title: Animals: Zoology Fun for Kids (4-7 yrs.)
camps.description: Explore the woods, creeks and ponds as we look for all sorts of critters. Learn about the animal life science of frogs, toads, birds, mammals, snakes, turtles, fish and insects through hikes, projects and games. *No camp June 19.*

camps.title: Mini-Hawk Sports Camp (4-6 yrs.)
camps.description: This multi-sport program was developed to give children a positive first step into athletics. Through exciting games and activities, campers explore balance, hand/eye coordination and skill development at their own pace.

camps.title: Mini-Hawk Sports Camp (4-6 yrs.)
camps.description: This multi-sport program was developed to give children a positive first step into athletics. Through exciting games and activities, campers explore balance, hand/eye coordination and skill development at their own pace.

camps.title: Kiddie Camp (3-5 yrs)
camps.description: Preschoolers will enjoy a variety of activities including music, movement, arts and crafts, outdoor games, water play, and a special event.

camps.title: Kiddie Camp (3-5 yrs)
camps.description: Preschoolers will enjoy a variety of activities including music, movement, arts and crafts, outdoor games, water play, and a special event.

camps.title: Super Scientist (5-7 yrs.)
camps.description: Come create some crazy chemical concoctions. Projects encourage self-exploration into the science world. Please bring a lunch, snack and a drink.

camps.title: Ballet & Hip Hop Camp (4-6 yrs)
camps.description: Dancers will experience two different dance styles in this Envision Camp. They will learn the foundation of ballet with terminology, positions, and creative movement. Then, campers explore different ways to move their bodies through hip hop with coordination, arithmetic, and choreography. Campers will also enjoy games and crafts during camp. Camp culminates with a performance for families at the end of the week.

camps.title: Volleyball Camp with Alpha Sports (8-12yrs)
camps.description: Learn to pass, set, and hit at Volleyball Camp with Alpha Sports. Learn the fundamentals of volleyball and participate in contests, scrimmages, and games. No camp June 19.

camps.title: Stay Cool Ice Skating Camp (6-9 yrs.)
camps.description:
Beat the heat and improve your ice-skating skills. Enjoy:
  - Daily on-ice lesson
  - Free skate time
  - On-ice games and activities
  - Off-ice activities
  
  Direct on-ice time is 1.5-2 hours. Camp includes free use of rental skates and five additional practice sessions.

camps.title: Young Anglers Fishing Camp (7-10 yrs.)
camps.description: Fish & Explore takes campers to lakes, rivers, and the Chesapeake Bay to catch fish, learn water safety, and nature awareness. Learn fresh and saltwater fishing basics including casting, rigging, knot tying, selecting tackle, and lures, and identifying fish.

camps.title: All About Animals (3.5-6 yrs)
camps.description: Katydid Kids camp based at the Old Floris Schoolhouse, includes daily farm visits. Learn facts and stories about animals through indoor and outdoor games, songs, and puppetry.

camps.title: Minecraft Architects: Building our World (5-12yrs)
camps.description: Unlock your child's inner architect, where creativity, history, and design come to life. Campers will explore famous architectural styles—from Roman aqueducts to futuristic cities—then bring their own designs to life in Minecraft.

camps.title: Flag Football (10-12 yrs)
camps.description: Experience to remember powered by Perfect Performance NFL Flag Football. Experienced coaching staff of current and former college/high school football players provide personalized instruction focusing on footwork, offensive and defensive skills, and game strategy.

camps.title: Little Astronauts (4-6 yrs)
camps.description: Spend a whole week of your summer in space. Travel from Earth to the moon, Mars and beyond. Enjoy hands-on activities such as rocket making, safe sun spotting and telescope viewing. Campers should bring a snack and lunch. *Camps the week of June 8 for non-FCPS participants.*

camps.title: Kiddie Camp (3-5 yrs)
camps.description: Preschoolers will enjoy a variety of activities including music, movement, arts and crafts, outdoor games, water play, and a special event.

camps.title: Kiddie Camp (3-5 yrs)
camps.description: Preschoolers will enjoy a variety of activities including music, movement, arts and crafts, outdoor games, water play, and a special event.

camps.title: Flag Football Camp (8-9 1/2 yrs.)
camps.description: This unique SMUV Sports camp focuses on fundamentals with drills and contests in two popular sports—baseball and flag football. Campers will enjoy game play daily. Rec Center camp includes an afternoon swim break.

camps.title: Academy of Magic & Balloon Sculptures (6-12y)
camps.description: Spirit Pros unlocks the secrets of magic as campers learn sleight of hand, rope restorations, and even levitation tricks. They'll twist balloons into animals, swords, and creative shapes to share with friends. The week wraps up with a magic showcase video, where every camper gets to amaze their family with what they've learned.

camps.title: ROBLOX Makers Virtual Camp (8-11yrs)
camps.description: Unlock the power of ROBLOX Studio, the world creation tool used by real-world developers. Build 3D models and create an adventure in your ROBLOX world. Design characters with unique animations. Projects available on Black Rocket's protected website. Compatible with MAC and Windows OS only.

camps.title: Junior LEGO Engineers (4-7 yrs)
camps.description: Join Snapology to build simple models using LEGO®: motorcycles, racecars, windmills and cranes. Experience pulleys, levers, gears, wheels and axles while exploring energy, buoyancy, and balance. Camp includes free-building time to promote creativity. Campers will learn basic engineering and mechanical ideas and practice early science skills. No camp July 3.

camps.title: Mini-Hawk Sports Camp (4-6 yrs.)
camps.description: This multi-sport program was developed to give children a positive first step into athletics. Through exciting games and activities, campers explore balance, hand/eye coordination and skill development at their own pace.

camps.title: Dance Camp (7-11yrs)
camps.description: During this Baroody dance camp, campers will learn choreography and movement to some of the most popular songs out today. Arts and crafts will also be incorporated as campers decorate props and shirts. After a week of hard work, campers will show off their new dance moves on the final day of camp.

camps.title: Stay Cool Ice Skating Camp (9-13 yrs)
camps.description:
Beat the heat and improve your ice-skating skills. Enjoy:

  - Free skate time
  - On-ice games and activities
  - Off-ice activities
  
  Direct on-ice time is 1.5-2 hours. Camp includes free use of rental skates and five additional practice sessions.

camps.title: Princess Ballet Camp (4-6yrs)
camps.description: Start the foundation of dance with Envision Dance's ballet camp. Campers learn ballet and creative movement through learning activities. We'll dance to our favorite princess songs, enjoy making crafts and learn about princesses through story time. Campers will put on a performance at the end of the week. No camp June 19.

camps.title: Baroody Kiddie Sports Camp (3-5 yrs.)
camps.description: Young campers are introduced to sports skills through games that enhance running, throwing, catching and teamwork in this Baroody camp. Other activities are included plus time for a lunch break. Pack a water bottle and bag lunch.

camps.title: Foundational Soccer Skills Camp (6-12yrs)
camps.description: Challenger Sports team of international and US-based staff helps improve campers' technical foundational skills while providing a unique cultural experience. Rooted in British training methodology, this curriculum and coaching foundation meets engaging delivery for an all-around positive experience. Soccer ball and Jersey included. Sign up to host a coach and receive a free week on camp.

camps.title: Python Programmers Virtual Camp(8-11 yrs.)
camps.description: Learn the world's fastest-growing programming language favored by Google, NASA, YouTube, and the CIA. Discover how to code with Python to create engaging apps and games. Step-by-step lessons on a programming path. Compatible with MAC, Windows, and Chrome OS.

camps.title: Art in Nature (4-6 yrs)
camps.description: Discover the shapes, colors, textures, and patterns hidden in the natural world through scientific exploration. Paint with natural dyes, sculpt with clay, craft musical instruments, design jewelry, and create a mosaic. The older group will enjoy an off-site day trip with transportation included.

camps.title: Cooking: Baroody Savory & Sweets (5-12yrs)
camps.description: Each camp day features a sweet treat that pairs with dinner and one savory dish. Learn new baking skills like creaming, whisking, and melting plus cooking skills such as stewing, stir-frying, and sautéing.

camps.title: Minecraft Modders Virtual Camp (11-14 yrs.)
camps.description: Learn scripting and logic statements to design your first mods and customize your own Minecraft world. Create new elements and gameplay mechanics. Requires Java version of Minecraft. Compatible with MAC and Windows OS only. Projects available on Black Rocket's protected website.

camps.title: Hoops & More: Basketball & Tennis  Camp (6-12 yrs)
camps.description: Players learn the fundamentals of basketball and tennis with JST. Camp includes confidence-building drills and matches incorporating skills learned. Activities include dribble tag, hot-seat and ultimate knockout. Bring racket, lunch, drink and swimsuit/towel for an afternoon swim break.

camps.title: Super Scientist (5-7 yrs.)
camps.description: Come create some crazy chemical concoctions. Projects encourage self-exploration into the science world. Please bring a lunch, snack and a drink.

camps.title: Minecraft Designers Virtual Camp (11-14 yrs.)
camps.description: Learn how to create custom maps, build with Redstone and Command blocks, and create custom textures to import. Requires Java version of Minecraft. Parent email required for 3D modeling software. Compatible with MAC and Windows OS only. Projects available on Black Rocket's protected website.

camps.title: Adventures on the Farm (6-10 yrs)
camps.description: Katydid camp where campers spend the morning on the farm with visits to animals, hikes, games, and crafts. Afternoon activities include learning about lives 100 years ago through toys, games, crafts, and pictures.

camps.title: Total Sports Camp (6-13 yrs.)
camps.description: Rich Sandler fast-paced, high-energy camp featuring a variety of sports including basketball, flag football, soccer, and track. Appropriate for boys and girls of all skill and experience levels. Includes daily swim break. No camp June 19 or July 3.

camps.title: Ballet & Hip Hop Camp (4-6 yrs)
camps.description: Dancers will experience two different dance styles in this Envision Camp. They will learn the foundation of ballet with terminology, positions, and creative movement. Then, campers explore different ways to move their bodies through hip hop with coordination, arithmetic, and choreography. Campers will also enjoy games and crafts during camp. Camp culminates with a performance for families at the end of the week.

camps.title: Ballet & Hip Hop Camp (4-6 yrs)
camps.description: Dancers will experience two different dance styles in this Envision Camp. They will learn the foundation of ballet with terminology, positions, and creative movement. Then, campers explore different ways to move their bodies through hip hop with coordination, arithmetic, and choreography. Campers will also enjoy games and crafts during camp. Camp culminates with a performance for families at the end of the week.

camps.title: YouTube Content Creator/Video Game Animation
camps.description: Join Black Rocket to learn video editing techniques used by professional YouTubers. Create your own personal brand and build a portfolio of videos you can share with friends and family. Then, flex your creative muscles as you master the basic skills that professional video game designers and digital animators use to make your favorite characters come to life in video games and cartoons.

camps.title: Lakeside Splash & Explore Camp (6-9 yrs.)
camps.description: Campers will enjoy fishing, hiking, nature crafts, games and boating lakeside. Camp includes swim time at our famous Water Mine Family Swimmin' Hole (dependent on weather/waterpark operation). Bring a swimsuit, towel, bag lunch, snacks and water bottle. Camp runs rain or shine. No camp June 19 and July 3.

camps.title: Stay Cool Ice Skating Camp (6-9 yrs.)
camps.description:
Beat the heat and improve your ice-skating skills. Enjoy:
  - Daily on-ice lesson
  - Free skate time
  - On-ice games and activities
  - Off-ice activities
  
  Direct on-ice time is 1.5-2 hours. Camp includes free use of rental skates and five additional practice sessions.

camps.title: Magic & Spy Camp (6-10 yrs.)
camps.description: SteamKidz Lab introduces campers to the science behind magic and how to be the best spy. Spend mornings making vanishing illusions and performing color-changing tricks. Through magic, explore chemistry, optics, physics, engineering, and life sciences. In the afternoon, you'll enter the spy training program and solve mysteries using handwriting analyses, secret codes, and special gadgets. Experiment with cool tools like periscopes. Campers should bring lunch, snack, and drink daily. *No camp June 19 and July 3.*

camps.title: Wildlife Rangers (4-7 yrs)
camps.description: Join our naturalist on outdoor adventures and field studies in nature. This is for serious nature lovers who don't mind getting dirty. Campers learn outdoor survival skills such as using maps, making fires, and building shelter. Experiments, games, activities, and observation skills help us explore the many habitats in our parks. No camp June 18-19 and July 3.

camps.title: Adult Potomac Adventures Camp  (Adults)
camps.description:
Join experienced instructors and immerse yourselves in the great outdoors with an all-adult adventure camp. Experience the Potomac River from every angle:
  - Rock climbing overlooking the river in Carderock, MD (transportation not included)
  - Fish and float trip from Clark's Branch
  - Guided hike down to Great Falls to learn history and geography of the gorge
  - Primitive skills and campfire cookout
  
  Prior fishing/boating experience is not required; beginners welcome.

camps.title: Minecraft Designers Virtual Camp(8-11 yrs.)
camps.description: Learn how to create custom maps, build with Redstone and Command blocks, and create custom textures to import. Requires Java version of Minecraft. Parent email required for 3D modeling software. Compatible with MAC and Windows OS only. Projects available on Black Rocket's protected website.

camps.title: Forces of Nature (6-9 yrs.)
camps.description: Plants, animals and sun are all forces in nature. Through experiments, campers will learn how weather impacts the earth, the role plants play as a natural force, and what animals change to their environment.

camps.title: Outdoor Adventures Camp (10-14 yrs)
camps.description: Step into the wild with Baroody Outside, where kids with a passion for the outdoors will explore nature's wonders. Each day presents new opportunities, from orienteering to kayaking, white water rafting, tubing, and hiking adventures.

camps.title: Fencing Camp with Fairfax Fencers (7-15 yrs.)
camps.description: In this action-packed camp, learn skills such as etiquette and fencing safety from all three Olympics fencing disciplines (foil, epee and saber). Show off your skills at the end-of-the-week camp tournament.

camps.title: Aqua Adventures (7-12 yrs)
camps.description: A great camp for high-level swimmers. Activities include water safety, swim clinics, water relays and water sports like volleyball and basketball. Campers also enjoy out-of-pool games/activities.

camps.title: Song & Dance Performing Arts Camp (6-12 yrs)
camps.description: Spirit Pros turns the week into a stage where kids sing upbeat favorites, learn dance routines, and design posters for the Friday performance (video recorded). Along the way they'll play team games, spark creativity, and make lasting friendships.

camps.title: All About Animals (3.5-6 yrs)
camps.description: Katydid Kids camp based at the Old Floris Schoolhouse, includes daily farm visits. Learn facts and stories about animals through indoor and outdoor games, songs, and puppetry.

camps.title: Native Animal Explorers(7-11 yrs)
camps.description: Fish & Explore transports campers off-site to hike trails, wade in streams, and walk pond and lake shores to find native wildlife. Campers observe, catch, photograph, and release frogs, toads, tadpoles, salamanders, lizards, turtles, crayfish, minnows, and other small critters.

camps.title: World Cup Soccer Camp (6-14 yrs)
camps.description: At Love the Ball Soccer channels that global excitement into unforgettable summer experience. Campers won't just play soccer—they'll celebrate it through fast-paced drills, creative skill challenges, and daily scrimmages. Each week features World Cup-themed games, country flag days, and mini-tournaments that bring the international spirit to life. No camp June 19.

camps.title: World Cup Soccer Camp (6-14 yrs)
camps.description: At Love the Ball Soccer channels that global excitement into unforgettable summer experience. camps.title: Ninja Obstacles & Tumbling Camp (5 1/2-12 yrs.)
camps.description: Be a ninja games warrior in this action-packed Metro Movement camp. Learn tumbling skills, jump across the floating steps and compete in our floor-based obstacle course challenge. Rec Center camps include an afternoon swim break. A signed participation release is due on the first day. No camp June 19 and July 3.

camps.title: Virtual Chess Camp  (6-13yr)
camps.description: Silver Knights (formerly Magnus Academy) online camp featuring a mix of live lessons, practice games, puzzles, and tournaments. Campers divided by skill so everyone gets useful lessons and fair games. Everything is online, so no physical board needed. *No camp on June 19 and July 3.*

camps.title: B2R Glee Camp (7-15yrs)
camps.description: Build your performance skills and learn how to sing as part of a larger group. Receive coaching from trained vocalists to learn, record and perform popular songs. Make the most of your singing voice while learning to care for your vocal cords, control volume and pitch and refine techniques like melody and harmony.

camps.title: Ballet & Butterflies Dance Camp (4-6yrs)
camps.description: Start the foundation of dance with ballet. Envision Dance campers learn ballet and creative movement techniques through games and arts and crafts. We'll also learn the cycle of butterflies during story time and dancing. Campers will put on a performance at the end of the week.

camps.title: Sew & Swim Camp (8-12 yrs.)
camps.description: Boys and girls will learn sewing basics including measuring, hand and machine techniques, maintenance and machine operation. Create a custom towel wrap or a waterproof swim bag. Bring a lunch, drink and swimsuit/towel (Wednesday and Friday) for afternoon swim break.

camps.title: Sew & Swim Camp (8-12 yrs.)
camps.description: Boys and girls will learn sewing basics including measuring, hand and machine techniques, maintenance and machine operation. Create a custom towel wrap or a waterproof swim bag. Bring a lunch, drink and swimsuit/towel (Wednesday and Friday) for afternoon swim break.

camps.title: Beading & Wire Wrapping Camp (8-14 yrs)
camps.description: Unleash your creativity in this hands-on jewelry-making camp. Explore the colorful world of beads and learn the art of wire wrapping to create unique, one-of-a-kind accessories. Design and craft dazzling bracelets, artistic pendants, and other wearable masterpieces. Perfect for beginners and budding jewelry artists.

camps.description: Explore the woods, creeks and ponds as we look for all sorts of critters. Learn about the animal life science of frogs, toads, birds, mammals, snakes, turtles, fish and insects through hikes, projects and games. *No camp June 19.*

camps.title: B2R Rock Band Camp (7-15 yrs)
camps.description: Practice and perform as part of a real rock band on the instrument of your choice. Bands receive coaching from professional musicians to learn, record, and perform at least two songs by the end of the week. Depending on the skill level of the students, bands are encouraged to write their own songs or pick from our 400+ popular arrangements. No music experience required.

This camp is for advanced players to sharpen their skills or beginners who want to learn the game. Campers will learn the rules, openings, tactics, strategy, endgames, while playing games and taking outdoor breaks.

camps.description: Boys and girls learn sewing basics including measuring, hand and machine techniques, maintenance and machine operation. Campers create a hand-painted waterproof skate tote bag and skate three days during camp.

camps.description: Virtual Camp. Learn the basics of coding languages like HTML, JavaScript and CSS through a series of web projects and design challenges. Projects will be available on Black Rocket's protected website. Compatible with MAC, Windows and Chrome OS. Online camp.

camps.description: US9 Baseball offers an instructional camp designed to teach both fundamentals and advanced skills. Students will work in pairs or teams for most of the program.

camps.title: Dance Camp (7-11yrs)
camps.description: During this Baroody dance camp, campers will learn choreography and movement to some of the most popular songs out today. Arts and crafts will also be incorporated as campers decorate props and shirts. After a week of hard work, campers will show off their new dance moves on the final day of camp.

camps.title: Flag Football Camp (7-11yrs)
camps.description: This unique SMUV Sports camp focuses on fundamentals with drills and contests in two popular sports—baseball and flag football. Campers will enjoy game play daily. Rec Center camp includes an afternoon swim break.

camps.title: Stay Cool Ice Skating Camp (9-13 yrs)
camps.description:
Beat the heat and improve your ice-skating skills. Enjoy:
  - Daily on-ice lesson
  - Free skate time
  - On-ice games and activities
  - Off-ice activities
  
  Direct on-ice time is 1.5-2 hours. Camp includes free use of rental skates and five additional practice sessions.

camps.title: STEM & Minecraft with LEGO® Materials (5-10yrs)
camps.description: Build projects inspired by cool machines while applying real-world concepts in physics, engineering, and architecture. Venture into the world of Minecraft in Play-Well TEKnologies' unique LEGO® experience. Build your base, craft your tools, use your Minecart to harvest raw resources, and battle to stop the Ender Dragon from ending the world.

camps.title: Princess Ballet Camp (4-6yrs)
camps.description: Start the foundation of dance with Envision Dance's ballet camp. Campers learn ballet and creative movement through learning activities. We'll dance to our favorite princess songs, enjoy making crafts and learn about princesses through story time. Campers will put on a performance at the end of the week. No camp June 19.

camps.title: Ultimate Gymnastics, Cheer & Dance (6-12)
camps.description: Three camps in one with Spirit Pros, featuring gymnastics skills and equipment instruction, cheer elements and routine training, and dance skills and combinations. The camp agenda is developed by a nationally ranked gymnast, a pro football captain cheerleader, and a national dance champion. Rec Center camps include an afternoon swim break.

camps.title: Foundational Soccer Skills Camp (6-12yrs)
camps.description: Challenger Sports team of international and US-based staff helps improve campers' technical foundational skills while providing a unique cultural experience. Rooted in British training methodology, this curriculum and coaching foundation meets engaging delivery for an all-around positive experience. Soccer ball and Jersey included. Sign up to host a coach and receive a free week on camp.

camps.title: Flag Football & Swim Camp (6-12 yrs.)
camps.description: SMUV Sports coaches help campers of any level develop and enhance football skills such as passing, catching, route running, offense/defensive positions and strategies. Enjoy a swim break each afternoon. Bring a lunch, snack, water bottle, and swimsuit/towel. *No camp June 19.*

camps.title: Softball Camp with US9 (7-13yrs)
camps.description: US9 Softball instructional camp teaching fundamentals and advanced skills. Includes daily scrimmage games, trivia contests, and instruction on pitching, hitting, baserunning, fielding, game situations, rules, and sportsmanship. Groups and teams created by age and/or experience to build confidence. No camp June 19 and July 3.

camps.title: Make Your First Video Game & Code Breakers (8-14y)
camps.description: Make your first video game in this Black Rocket camp that gives you the keys to designing your first 2D platformer game. Conceptualization, level design, graphics, sprite animation, sound effects, and simple coding are just some of the concepts that you'll explore. Then, dive into basic coding concepts through a series of web projects and design challenges. No prior experience is necessary. *No camp June 19 or July 3.*

camps.title: Baroody Soccer Camp (6-12 yrs.)
camps.description: Baroody camp featuring games using soccer skills that progress to small-sided soccer. Activities include dribbling, ball control, passing, shooting, and 1-on-1 skills with team participation. No camp June 19 or July 3.

camps.title: Adult Women in the Woods Camp (Adults)
camps.description:
Immerse yourselves into the wilderness with an all-adult adventure camp. Join a group of women to learn practical primitive skills and how to protect the outdoors through leave no trace principles. Activities include:
  - Rock climbing along the Potomac in Carderock, MD (transportation not included)
  - Paddling
  - Fire building
  - Outdoor cooking
  - Archery
  - Setting up a campsite
  - Foraging

camps.title: STEM & Dino Design with LEGO® (5-7 yrs)
camps.description: Join a Play-Well TEKnologies instructor as you explore real-world concepts in physics, engineering, and architecture through engineer-designed projects. Then, travel back to the Jurassic era to design habitats, embark on daring expeditions, and uncover the secrets of powerful predator dinosaurs. This dino-sized STEM adventure is packed with building, problem-solving, and imagination. No camp June 19.

camps.title: Beltway Lacrosse Summer Camp (6-14 yrs)
camps.description: Beltway Summer Camps put the fun back in youth sports! Kids dive into fast-paced lacrosse action, learn from pro players, and enjoy team challenges and classic games—all summer long. No lines, no waiting—just pure play and a love for the game.

camps.title: NASA: Academy of Future Space Explorers (6-10yrs)
camps.description: Blast off with a camp designed and created by NASA engineers. Join Mad Science to set your trajectory from Earth's atmosphere to the outer reaches of our solar system. This hands-on program will bring campers closer to the stars, planets, and comets. Learn about living in space, getting away from gravity, looking for space phenomena, and participate in a rocket launch.

camps.title: Minecraft Redstone Engineers Virtual Camp 11-14
camps.description: Take the next step beyond playing Minecraft and become a true Redstone engineer. Construct your own carnival with mini-games, roller coasters, and attractions powered by Redstone. Learn to use Command and Structure blocks. Requires Java version of Minecraft. Compatible with MAC and Windows OS only.

camps.title: Adventures on the Farm (6-10 yrs)
camps.description: Katydid camp where campers spend the morning on the farm with visits to animals, hikes, games, and crafts. Afternoon activities include learning about lives 100 years ago through toys, games, crafts, and pictures.

camps.title: Action Movie & Stop Motion Flix (7-13 yrs.)
camps.description: Two camps in one with Incrediflix. In the mornings, there's no limits in your action packed movie when using a green screen and camera tricks. Collaborate to write, act, and direct in this stunt packed movie where you'll be taught action choreography to thrill the audience. In the afternoon, make your own stop-motion movie using Pokémon characters. Work in small groups to storyboard, film, and voice-over your adventure.

camps.title: Animals: Zoology Fun for Kids (6-11 yrs.)
camps.description: Explore the woods, creeks and ponds as we look for all sorts of critters. Learn about the animal life science of frogs, toads, birds, mammals, snakes, turtles, fish and insects through hikes, projects and games. *No camp June 19.*

camps.title: Animals: Zoology Fun for Kids (6-11 yrs.)
camps.description: Explore the woods, creeks and ponds as we look for all sorts of critters. Learn about the animal life science of frogs, toads, birds, mammals, snakes, turtles, fish and insects through hikes, projects and games. *No camp June 19.*

camps.title: Total Sports Camp (6-13 yrs.)
camps.description: Rich Sandler fast-paced, high-energy camp featuring a variety of sports including basketball, flag football, soccer, and track. Appropriate for boys and girls of all skill and experience levels. Includes daily swim break. No camp June 19 or July 3.

camps.title: Archery Camp at Bull Run (9-15 yrs.)
camps.description: An indoor 3-day camp where campers develop archery skills using Olympic-style (recurve) bows. Focused instruction teaches patience, focus, and attention to detail. Additional archery-related activities provide a broader introduction. Equipment is provided. Bring a snack and drink.

camps.title: Bricking Fun LEGO® Robotics Jr (5-8 yrs)
camps.description: In this exciting Snapology robotics workshop, campers build a Rover Bot that responds to color and a Surgeon Bot that can be controlled using buttons. They'll learn the fundamentals of robotic movement, sensing, and programming as they bring their creations to life.

camps.title: Allegro Song & Voice Camp (6-12 yrs)
camps.description: In this high energy Rich Sandler song and voice camp, campers learn vocal techniques, tell stories through up-tempo songs and games and create an interactive choir performance. Rec Center camps include a swim break.

camps.title: Stay Cool Ice Skating Camp (6-9 yrs.)
camps.description:
Beat the heat and improve your ice-skating skills. Enjoy:
  - Daily on-ice lesson
  - Free skate time
  - On-ice games and activities
  - Off-ice activities
  
  Direct on-ice time is 1.5-2 hours. Camp includes free use of rental skates and five additional practice sessions.

camps.title: Lakeside Nature Discovery Camp (6-10 yrs.)
camps.description: Campers enjoy guided nature hikes, crafts and fishing and boat rides (if available). Shaded trails and lakefronts are perfect settings for exploring creatures and plants that live in our streams, lakes and forests. Lake Accotink meets at the large shelter by marina; Burke Lake meets at shelter C. Camps run rain or shine. Contact the park for details on extreme weather days. No camp July 3.

camps.title: Young Anglers Fishing Camp (7-10 yrs.)
camps.description: Fish & Explore takes campers to lakes, rivers, and the Chesapeake Bay to catch fish, learn water safety, and nature awareness. Learn fresh and saltwater fishing basics including casting, rigging, knot tying, selecting tackle, and lures, and identifying fish.

camps.title: Freshwater Fishing Fun Camp (8-12 yrs)
camps.description: Gain knowledge and experience in freshwater fishing using a variety of tackle. Fish the Potomac River for sunfish, catfish and bass on land and by boat. Learn how to rig and use a fishing rod as well as the safety and importance of catch-and-release fishing. Bring a rod or borrow one from the park.

camps.title: Girls Only: Games, Balloons & Crafts Camp (6-10y)
camps.description: Spirit Pros creates a girls-only space that blends creativity and play, helping girls build confidence. Campers will craft bracelets, twist balloon animals, and jump into team challenges like an inflatable Gaga pit.

camps.title: Fencing Camp with Fairfax Fencers (7-15 yrs.)
camps.description: In this action-packed camp, learn skills such as etiquette and fencing safety from all three Olympics fencing disciplines (foil, epee and saber). Show off your skills at the end-of-the-week camp tournament.

camps.title: Aqua Adventures (7-12 yrs)
camps.description: A great camp for high-level swimmers. Activities include water safety, swim clinics, water relays and water sports like volleyball and basketball. Campers also enjoy out-of-pool games/activities.

camps.title: Aqua Adventures (7-12 yrs)
camps.description: A great camp for high-level swimmers. Activities include water safety, swim clinics, water relays and water sports like volleyball and basketball. Campers also enjoy out-of-pool games/activities.

camps.title: All About Animals (3.5-6 yrs)
camps.description: Katydid Kids camp based at the Old Floris Schoolhouse, includes daily farm visits. Learn facts and stories about animals through indoor and outdoor games, songs, and puppetry.

camps.title: Archery Camp at Burke Lake (9-13 yrs.)
camps.description: Campers develop archery skills using Olympic-style (recurve) bows through focused instruction in shooting techniques and attention to detail. Additional activities include mini-golf and nature hikes along the lakefront. Camp operation is subject to weather and is held at the archery field to the right as you enter the park.

camps.title: Native Animal Explorers(7-11 yrs)
camps.description: Fish & Explore transports campers off-site to hike trails, wade in streams, and walk pond and lake shores to find native wildlife. Campers observe, catch, photograph, and release frogs, toads, tadpoles, salamanders, lizards, turtles, crayfish, minnows, and other small critters.

camps.title: 3D Game Design with Unity (8-11 yrs.)
camps.description: Virtual Camp. With Unity, an industry-grade design software, aspiring game designers will learn level editing, 3D modeling, impactful gameplay creation, and how to utilize scripts and variables. Projects will be available on Black Rocket's protected website. Compatible with MAC and Windows OS only and requires a 64-bit operating system.

camps.title: World Cup Soccer Camp (6-14 yrs)
camps.description: At Love the Ball Soccer channels that global excitement into unforgettable summer experience. Campers won't just play soccer—they'll celebrate it through fast-paced drills, creative skill challenges, and daily scrimmages. Each week features World Cup-themed games, country flag days, and mini-tournaments that bring the international spirit to life. No camp June 19.

camps.title: Explore Science & Robo Fun (6-12yrs)
camps.description: Robots inspire campers to learn engineering and apply their basic science, model construction, computer programming, problem-solving skills, and knowledge to explore STEM concepts. Spark curiosity and deepen appreciation for science through engaging and hands-on learning experiences. Stemtree curriculum empowers campers to become confident scientific thinkers by exploring the core principles of science. Previous participants will continue learning new concepts.

camps.title: Native American Survival Skills Camp (6-11 yrs.)
camps.description: Discover what daily life was like for the Eastern Woodland American Indians. From animal tracking to shelter building, children learn survival skills through outdoor activities and games. Camp focuses on the culture and lives of the Powhatan. Some sites include tool making and a cookout on the last day.

camps.title: Art Explorers Camp (5-7 yrs.)
camps.description: Explore art mediums through craft projects, painting, drawing, beading, paper arts, and sculpting. Emphasis is on creativity, games, and the love of art.

camps.title: All About Horses Summer Camp (8-10 yrs.)
camps.description: Campers learn about tacking, grooming, general horse care, and barn chores with daily 30-minute riding lessons. Other horse-related activities include arts and crafts, equine speakers, and breed demonstrations.

camps.title: Big Fish Fishing Camp (10-16 yrs.)
camps.description: Fish & Explore takes campers off site to teach fishing basics and more intensive fishing techniques, including targeting specific fish species, reading the water and navigation safety. All gear including tackle, rods, reels and life jackets supplied.

camps.title: Adult Pickleball Camp (Adults)
camps.description: Pickleball is a fast-paced paddle sport that combines tennis, table tennis, and badminton. Learn the rules of the game, the basics, and practice skills. Campers will work together as a team while competing in lightly competitive tournament-style matches.

camps.title: Farm Zoology Camp (8-12yrs)
camps.description: Explore the science behind the animals that live at Frying Pan Farm Park. Learn about the habits and biology of our farm animals and their wild ancestors. Meet the countless creatures that live in stream and forest habitats. Activities include hands-on lessons with farm animals, nature hikes, games and crafts.

camps.title: Pottery Around the World (5-12 yrs)
camps.description: Travel the globe (without leaving the studio) to discover how people all over the world create amazing pottery with Mudskippers. Get your hands messy making your own clay creations inspired by different cultures. Pottery will be fired in a kiln so you'll have real, lasting artwork. At the end of camp, we'll celebrate with a special art show where you can show off your masterpieces to family and friends.

camps.title: Ninja Obstacles & Tumbling Camp (5 1/2-12 yrs.)
camps.description: Be a ninja games warrior in this action-packed Metro Movement camp. Learn tumbling skills, jump across the floating steps and compete in our floor-based obstacle course challenge. Rec Center camps include an afternoon swim break. A signed participation release is due on the first day. No camp June 19 and July 3.

camps.title: Envision Dance Camp (6-12 yrs.)
camps.description: Learn many styles including ballet, jazz and hip-hop. A great way to discover many dance styles in one week. Learn dance terminology, positions and choreography. Campers will also enjoy games and crafts and will put on a performance at the end of the week. Rec Center camps include a swim break.

camps.title: Flag Football Camp (6-12 yrs.)
camps.description: This unique SMUV Sports camp focuses on fundamentals with drills and contests in two popular sports—baseball and flag football. Campers will enjoy game play daily. Rec Center camp includes an afternoon swim break.

camps.title: Minecraft & Computer Science (6-12 yr)
camps.description: STEM exCEL campers will use programming fundamentals to design and implement large-scale Minecraft modifications. Hands-on activities introduce vital concepts using drag-and-drop interface to create programs, solve problems and design games. Learn functions, variables and conditionals. *No camp July 3.*

camps.title: Virtual Chess Camp  (6-13yr)
camps.description: Silver Knights (formerly Magnus Academy) online camp featuring a mix of live lessons, practice games, puzzles, and tournaments. Campers divided by skill so everyone gets useful lessons and fair games. Everything is online, so no physical board needed. *No camp on June 19 and July 3.*

camps.title: B2R Glee Camp (7-15yrs)
camps.description: Build your performance skills and learn how to sing as part of a larger group. Receive coaching from trained vocalists to learn, record and perform popular songs. Make the most of your singing voice while learning to care for your vocal cords, control volume and pitch and refine techniques like melody and harmony.

camps.title: Tennis Camp (6-12 yrs.)
camps.description: JST Athletics outdoor tennis instruction through drills and games to improve skills. Bring tennis racket and one can of tennis balls. Full-day camps include afternoon swim break and require swimsuit/towel daily. No camp July 3.

camps.title: Sew & Swim Camp (8-12 yrs.)
camps.description: Boys and girls will learn sewing basics including measuring, hand and machine techniques, maintenance and machine operation. Create a custom towel wrap or a waterproof swim bag. Bring a lunch, drink and swimsuit/towel (Wednesday and Friday) for afternoon swim break.

camps.title: Junior Gardeners (7-11 yrs)
camps.description: Get your hands dirty at Green Spring Gardens. Plant herbs and flowers, grow and harvest food, and even help design a garden space. Explore the plant life cycle and discover why they need pollinators like bees, butterflies and birds. Spend time outside all the while learning about how gardens grow and why they matter to people, animals, and the planet.

camps.title: Beading & Wire Wrapping Camp (8-14 yrs)
camps.description: Unleash your creativity in this hands-on jewelry-making camp. Explore the colorful world of beads and learn the art of wire wrapping to create unique, one-of-a-kind accessories. Design and craft dazzling bracelets, artistic pendants, and other wearable masterpieces. Perfect for beginners and budding jewelry artists.

camps.title: Tumbling & Cheer Camp (5 1/2-12 yrs.)
camps.description: In this Metro Movement camp, taught by former NFL, NBA, and other trained cheerleaders and gymnasts, campers will enjoy tumbling, cheers, stunt skills, and games.

camps.title: Applause! Despicable You (7-14yr)
camps.description: In this Moonlit Wings two-week camp, kids star in an original musical parody inspired by the world of the Minions, featuring mischievous characters, silly twists, and a new heartwarming story. Explore improvisation games, character creation and a talent show while developing imagination, storytelling skills, and teamwork. All levels welcome. Family and friends enjoy a mini performance on the last day. Rec Center camps bring swimsuit/towel for afternoon swim break.

camps.title: Accotink Adventure Camp (9-13 yrs.)
camps.description: Join us for the ultimate outdoor camp that includes fishing, hiking, off road biking, animal tracking, and animal identification. Bring lunch, snack and water bottle daily. Camps run rain or shine. Contact the park for details on extreme weather days. *No camp July 3.*

camps.title: B2R Rock Band Camp (7-15 yrs)
camps.description: Practice and perform as part of a real rock band on the instrument of your choice. Bands receive coaching from professional musicians to learn, record, and perform at least two songs by the end of the week. Depending on the skill level of the students, bands are encouraged to write their own songs or pick from our 400+ popular arrangements. No music experience required.

camps.title: B2R Rock Band Camp (7-15 yrs)
camps.description: Practice and perform as part of a real rock band on the instrument of your choice. Bands receive coaching from professional musicians to learn, record, and perform at least two songs by the end of the week. Depending on the skill level of the students, bands are encouraged to write their own songs or pick from our 400+ popular arrangements. No music experience required.

camps.title: All Star Gymnastics (4-7- yrs.)
camps.description: Young KinderJam gymnasts will explore basic gymnastics skills while enjoying cooperative games, arts and crafts, and outdoor play. Bring a snack, lunch, and water.

camps.title: Brazilian Soccer World Cup Camp (7-14yrs)
camps.description: Channels global excitement into unforgettable summer camp. Campers won't just play soccer—they'll celebrate it. Through fast-paced drills, creative skill challenges, and daily scrimmages, campers build confidence, teamwork, and lasting friendships. Each week features World Cup-themed games, country flag days, and mini-tournaments that bring the international spirit to life.

camps.title: A.I. Adventures - Intro to Machine Learning (8-11)
camps.description: Virtual Camp. Explore the world of artificial intelligence to design fully interactive games and experiences using cutting-edge technology. Combine artificial intelligence with coding to create an unforgettable learning adventure. Construct machine learning models that use image and text recognition within block-based coding software to build a portfolio of projects. Projects will be available on Black Rocket's password protected website.

camps.title: Kiddie Camp (3-5 yrs)
camps.description: Preschoolers will enjoy a variety of activities including music, movement, arts and crafts, outdoor games, water play, and a special event.

camps.title: Mountain Biking Camp (9-14 yrs.)
camps.description:
Join Baroody Outside for an exhilarating experience for young riders to master the art of mountain biking. From foundational skills to tackling intermediate challenges, campers will receive instruction on:
- Steering and shifting
- Hill climbing and descending
- Obstacle negotiation
- Trail etiquette
- Bike maintenance and safety

camps.title: Mountain Biking Camp (9-14 yrs.)
camps.description:
Join Baroody Outside for an exhilarating experience for young riders to master the art of mountain biking. From foundational skills to tackling intermediate challenges, campers will receive instruction on:
- Steering and shifting
- Hill climbing and descending
- Obstacle negotiation
- Trail etiquette
- Bike maintenance and safety

camps.title: Bricking Fun LEGO® Engineering Jr (5-8 yrs)
camps.description: Dive headfirst into the world of simple machines with Snapology. Construct, tinker, and explore the hidden mechanics that make everyday objects work. From gears and pulleys to levers and inclined planes, uncover the secrets behind the LEGO® creations you love and unleash your inner engineer.

camps.title: Beginning Athletes with JST (6-12 yrs.)
camps.description: This JST camp gives campers a chance to try out a different sport every day: basketball, flag football, soccer, baseball and tennis. Rec Center camps include an afternoon swim break.

camps.title: Pottery & Sweets Camp (5-12 yrs)
camps.description: Mix pottery with tasty treats in this Mudskippers camp. First, hand-build your very own mini serveware—perfect for holding cookies, cupcakes, and other goodies. Then, roll up your sleeves to bake, design, and decorate delicious sweets. Your pottery will be fired in our kiln so you'll have real, functional artwork you can keep forever. At the end of camp, celebrate with a special art show.

camps.title: Junior Lifeguard Camp (11-14 yrs)
camps.description: Learn skills and techniques used by lifeguards to help you prepare for future certification. (FCPA lifeguards receive formal training at age 15). Campers are introduced to CPR, first aid and rescue techniques.

camps.title: Junior Lifeguard Camp (11-14 yrs)
