In the afternoon, you'll enter the spy training program and solve mysteries using handwriting analyses, secret codes, and special gadgets. Experiment with cool tools like periscopes. Campers should bring lunch, snack, and drink daily. *No camp June 19 and July 3.*

camps.title: Soap & Candles Shop Startup (6-10 yrs)
camps.description: Create awesome soaps, fizzy bath bombs, and yummy-smelling candles. Then, become a business owner, coming up with your own brand, designing cool packaging, and making ads. At the end of the week, you'll proudly display your creations in this Steam Kidz camp for others to enjoy. No camp July 3.

camps.title: Soap & Candles Shop Startup (6-10 yrs)
camps.description: Create awesome soaps, fizzy bath bombs, and yummy-smelling candles. Then, become a business owner, coming up with your own brand, designing cool packaging, and making ads. At the end of the week, you'll proudly display your creations in this Steam Kidz camp for others to enjoy. No camp July 3.

camps.title: World Travel in 3D (5 1/2-12 yrs.)
camps.description: Create 3D masterpieces with Abrakadoodle inspired by world cultures. Create art using a variety of materials, play games, and understand that through art we can connect with people from all over the world.

camps.title: World Travel in 3D (5 1/2-12 yrs.)
camps.description: Create 3D masterpieces with Abrakadoodle inspired by world cultures. Create art using a variety of materials, play games, and understand that through art we can connect with people from all over the world.

camps.title: Lakeside Nature Discovery Camp (7-10yrs)
camps.description: Campers enjoy guided nature hikes, crafts and fishing and boat rides (if available). Shaded trails and lakefronts are perfect settings for exploring creatures and plants that live in our streams, lakes and forests. Lake Accotink meets at the large shelter by marina; Burke Lake meets at shelter C. Camps run rain or shine. Contact the park for details on extreme weather days. No camp July 3.

camps.title: Paper Crafts Camp (6-14 yrs)
camps.description: Dive into the colorful world of paper art including origami creations, decorative papier-mâché masks and mock stained glass. This camp is all about turning simple paper into amazing works of art.

camps.title: Art in Nature (6-9 yrs)
camps.description: Discover the shapes, colors, textures, and patterns hidden in the natural world through scientific exploration. Paint with natural dyes, sculpt with clay, craft musical instruments, design jewelry, and create a mosaic. The older group will enjoy an off-site day trip with transportation included.

camps.title: Backyard Science Camp (5-8yrs)
camps.description: Investigate the properties of water and air, make bubbling concoctions, learn about electricity, and the science of bubbles. Older campers will also learn about bacteria and DNA.

camps.title: Amusement Park Engineers (7-12yrs)
camps.description: In this Snapology camp, campers become an engineer of their own amusement park ride and learn the core physics and engineering concepts used to make a ride thrilling.

camps.title: Master Chef (10-14yrs)
camps.description: Campers cook breakfast, lunch, and dinner while learning advanced techniques and boosting kitchen creativity. By week's end, they'll face challenges and earn the ultimate title: Master Chef.

camps.title: Creative Skills Soccer Camp (6-13yrs)
camps.description: In this Challenger Sports camp with inflatable fields, music and international coaches, campers use the street skills that lie in the heart of all great soccer players. This accelerates a player's learning and assists them to produce better performance on the field. This program goes beyond technical skills and focuses on the psychological and philosophical combined aspects to create an atmosphere which fosters creative player development. Sign up to host a coach and receive a free week on camp.

camps.title: Robotics & Redstone (6-12yrs)
camps.description: Design, build and program LEGO® Mindstorms EV3 robots with STEM exCEL. Apply engineering concepts and advanced sensor programming skills to design and solve a variety of challenges. Use Minecraft's Redstone material to explore the fundamentals of electronics and circuitry. Learn functions, variables and conditionals by using Redstone blocks to build constructs in your Minecraft world.

camps.title: NASA: Academy of Future Space Explorers (6-10yrs)
camps.description: Blast off with a camp designed and created by NASA engineers. Join Mad Science to set your trajectory from Earth's atmosphere to the outer reaches of our solar system. This hands-on program will bring campers closer to the stars, planets, and comets. Learn about living in space, getting away from gravity, looking for space phenomena, and participate in a rocket launch.

camps.title: Gymnastics Camp (5 1/2-12 yrs.)
camps.description: Campers will flip head over heels in this Metro Movement gymnastics camp. Build skills and learn to master the balance beam, bars, floor and vault. Rec Center camps include an afternoon swim break. A signed participation release is due on the first day. No camp July 3.

camps.title: B2R Beat Making Camp (8-15yrs)
camps.description: Discover the world of DJing and music production. Learn how to make your own beats and craft songs through loop, beats and samples on the popular music production program, BandLab.

camps.title: Adventures on the Farm (6-10 yrs)
camps.description: Katydid camp where campers spend the morning on the farm with visits to animals, hikes, games, and crafts. Afternoon activities include learning about lives 100 years ago through toys, games, crafts, and pictures.

camps.title: Animals: Zoology Fun for Kids (6-11 yrs.)
camps.description: Explore the woods, creeks and ponds as we look for all sorts of critters. Learn about the animal life science of frogs, toads, birds, mammals, snakes, turtles, fish and insects through hikes, projects and games. *No camp June 19.*

camps.title: Total Sports Camp (6-13 yrs.)
camps.description: Rich Sandler fast-paced, high-energy camp featuring a variety of sports including basketball, flag football, soccer, and track. Appropriate for boys and girls of all skill and experience levels. Includes daily swim break. No camp June 19 or July 3.

camps.title: Artosaurus Art Camp (3 1/2 -6 yrs)
camps.description: Explore the wild world of dinosaurs and other reptiles with Abrakadoodle. Experiment with a variety of art techniques while learning about science, technology, engineering, and math concepts used to study extinct animals.

camps.title: Secret Agent Lab (6-10yrs)
camps.description: Connect the dots using science to help solve a crime in this hands-on Mad Science camp. Uncover the science involved in evidence gathering, analysis, and fingerprint detection. Enhance your recall and observation skills and learn how to use spy equipment. No camp July 3.

camps.title: 3D Printing & Comics (6-12 yrs)
camps.description: Bring your favorite superheroes to life or create your own with Stem exCEL. Learn to create and print 3D objects from famous comics or movies while learning about comic composition concepts and basic art theory for using digital art software.

camps.title: Camp Crescendo (6-12 yrs.)
camps.description: This Rich Sandler music variety camp allows children the opportunity to improvise, create and explore music in several ways. Campers will have small-group lessons on guitar and ukulele on provided instruments. Children also create music on xylophones, glockenspiels and percussion instruments. The week culminates with a performance for family and friends. Rec Center camps include a swim break.

camps.title: Archery Camp at Bull Run (9-15 yrs.)
camps.description: An indoor 3-day camp where campers develop archery skills using Olympic-style (recurve) bows. Focused instruction teaches patience, focus, and attention to detail. Additional archery-related activities provide a broader introduction. Equipment is provided. Bring a snack and drink.

camps.title: eSports & Games Camp (8-13 yrs)
camps.description: Campers will play a variety of eSports options on multiple gaming systems (e.g., Super Smash Bros., Mario Kart, Mario Party, NBA 2K, Madden, Rocket League). There will be time for free play, tournaments, and learning strategy. Campers will also learn other games including shuffleboard, foosball, air hockey, pool, cornhole, bocce ball. We will emphasize fair play, sportsmanship, and team play. Swim time included.

camps.title: Minecraft & Computer Science (6-12 yr)
camps.description: STEM exCEL campers will use programming fundamentals to design and implement large-scale Minecraft modifications. Hands-on activities introduce vital concepts using drag-and-drop interface to create programs, solve problems and design games. Learn functions, variables and conditionals. *No camp July 3.*

camps.title: Kids on Canvas (5 1/2-12 yrs)
camps.description: Use paints to explore traditional painting subjects such as figure, landscape, and still life – with a fresh Abrakadoodle twist – while learning about a variety of artists.

camps.title: Kids on Canvas (5 1/2-12 yrs)
camps.description: Use paints to explore traditional painting subjects such as figure, landscape, and still life – with a fresh Abrakadoodle twist – while learning about a variety of artists.

camps.title: The Great Cupcake Showdown (6-10 yrs)
camps.description: Cupcake Wars 3.0. Campers will master baking basics, refine frosting and piping skills, and compete in team challenges to win the title of Best Cupcake.

camps.title: Science in Motion Camp (6-10 yrs.)
camps.description: Discover how things move with Mad Science. Study the lives of birds, structures and simple machines. Put on your lab coat and be a chemist for the day. Make and bring home animal houses, challenging puzzles and chemistry-based creations. The perfect introduction to all things scientific.

camps.title: Stay Cool Ice Skating Camp (6-9 yrs.)
camps.description:
Beat the heat and improve your ice-skating skills. Enjoy:
  - Daily on-ice lesson
  - Free skate time
  - On-ice games and activities
  - Off-ice activities
  
  Direct on-ice time is 1.5-2 hours. Camp includes free use of rental skates and five additional practice sessions.

camps.title: May the Force Be with You (5-8 yr)
camps.description: Explore how things move and learn about sinking, floating, flight and balance with the Science Seed. You'll also experiment with gravity, magnets, friction and simple machines. Campers will also enjoy outdoor recess, story time tied to the day's science, free reading, exploration and a daily journal entry. *No camp July 3.*

camps.title: Bricking Fun LEGO® Robotics (8-12 yrs)
camps.description: Design, build, and program your own LEGO® creations that come to life with Snapology. Unlock the secrets of sensors, motors, and coding as you transform simple bricks into intelligent, programmable robots. Problem-solve, experiment, and unleash your inner techno-wizard as you bring your masterpieces to life.

camps.title: Yoga Camp (6-12 yrs)
camps.description: An Athena camp where campers learn yoga poses, breathing techniques, and mindfulness designed specifically for kids. This practice improves focus, flexibility, and stress management.

camps.title: Lakeside Nature Discovery Camp (6-10 yrs.)
camps.description: Campers enjoy guided nature hikes, crafts and fishing and boat rides (if available). Shaded trails and lakefronts are perfect settings for exploring creatures and plants that live in our streams, lakes and forests. Lake Accotink meets at the large shelter by marina; Burke Lake meets at shelter C. Camps run rain or shine. Contact the park for details on extreme weather days. No camp July 3.

camps.title: eSports & More (6-12yrs)
camps.description: This unique One on One camp combines physical activity with the most popular eSports games. Develop on-court skills and play various games. Emphasis is on teamwork and sportsmanship. Spend time in the eSports lab working on gaming technique and strategy using NBA2K, Madden, FIFA, NHL, Gran Turismo and MLB The Show. Skills are put to the test with Championship Friday.

camps.title: Minecraft Creative Adventures (5-12 yrs)
camps.description: In the boundless universe of Minecraft, campers will use their creativity to construct everything from small villages to grand castles in this Baroody camp. They'll learn the basics of Minecraft, including navigation, block types, and building techniques. The program encourages individual creativity, allowing campers to express their imaginations through virtual worlds!

camps.title: Adventures in Musical Theater (5-8yrs)
camps.description: Join KinderJam as we perform an original musical piece. Campers will build confidence and public speaking skills while rehearsing a scripted performance to be showcased at the end of the week. Bring two snacks, lunch, and water. Rec Center camps may include an afternoon swim break.

camps.title: Adventures in Musical Theater (5-8yrs)
camps.description: Join KinderJam as we perform an original musical piece. Campers will build confidence and public speaking skills while rehearsing a scripted performance to be showcased at the end of the week. Bring two snacks, lunch, and water. Rec Center camps may include an afternoon swim break.

camps.title: Little Lakeside Nature Explorers (4-6 yrs.)
camps.description: Young nature explorers will enjoy a variety of games, guided park walks, treasure hunts, nature lessons and arts and crafts. Campers will take advantage of the early, cooler temperatures to explore the park then enjoy a shaded lunch break and other activities in the pavilion. Bring a lunch and drink. Camps run rain or shine.

camps.title: Young Anglers Fishing Camp (7-10 yrs.)
camps.description: Fish & Explore takes campers to lakes, rivers, and the Chesapeake Bay to catch fish, learn water safety, and nature awareness. Learn fresh and saltwater fishing basics including casting, rigging, knot tying, selecting tackle, and lures, and identifying fish.

camps.title: Science for Wizards (7-11 yrs)
camps.description: Explore science with this spell-binding camp filled with an array of bewitching lessons and experiments mesmerizing even the most astute sorcerer. Study natural herbs, potion preparations, mythical creatures in this outdoor and indoor camp. Riverbend camp enjoys a visit from live owls.

camps.title: Ingenious Innovators Camp (8-12yrs)
camps.description: Meet some of the most famous inventions and inventors from the past and present. Harness the power of the engineering design process to design and build prototypes using the same tools, skills and thinking methods employed by famous innovators. Create catapults and forts, construct working light sticks and a suspension bridge from recycle materials in this SciGenie camp.

camps.title: Outdoor Adventures Camp (10-14 yrs)
camps.description: Step into the wild with Baroody Outside, where kids with a passion for the outdoors will explore nature's wonders. Each day presents new opportunities, from orienteering to kayaking, white water rafting, tubing, and hiking adventures.

camps.title: Outdoor Adventures Camp (10-14 yrs)
camps.description: Step into the wild with Baroody Outside, where kids with a passion for the outdoors will explore nature's wonders. Each day presents new opportunities, from orienteering to kayaking, white water rafting, tubing, and hiking adventures.

camps.title: Fencing Camp with Fairfax Fencers (7-15 yrs.)
camps.description: In this action-packed camp, learn skills such as etiquette and fencing safety from all three Olympics fencing disciplines (foil, epee and saber). Show off your skills at the end-of-the-week camp tournament.

camps.title: Aqua Adventures (7-12 yrs)
camps.description: A great camp for high-level swimmers. Activities include water safety, swim clinics, water relays and water sports like volleyball and basketball. Campers also enjoy out-of-pool games/activities.

camps.title: Mind Quest Camp (7-13 yrs)
camps.description: Learn new magic with Incrediflix and what it means to be a magician. Put your creative side in gear while exploring a variety of drawing techniques and determine the best path to victory by applying game strategies. Challenge yourself to think outside the box as we work together to solve detective mysteries.

camps.title: All About Animals (3.5-6 yrs)
camps.description: Katydid Kids camp based at the Old Floris Schoolhouse, includes daily farm visits. Learn facts and stories about animals through indoor and outdoor games, songs, and puppetry.

camps.title: Volleyball Camp (7-13 yrs)
camps.description: Skyhawks takes the energy and excitement of this great team sport and puts it all together into one program. All aspects of the game are taught through drills and exercises that focus on bumping, setting, spiking, hitting and serving. This program is designed for the beginning to intermediate player and includes a focus on critical life skills such as leadership and teamwork. Every camper receives an award certificate and Skyhawks t-shirt.

camps.title: Archery Camp at Burke Lake (9-13 yrs.)
camps.description: Campers develop archery skills using Olympic-style (recurve) bows through focused instruction in shooting techniques and attention to detail. Additional activities include mini-golf and nature hikes along the lakefront. Camp operation is subject to weather and is held at the archery field to the right as you enter the park.

camps.title: 3D Game Design with Unity (8-11 yrs.)
camps.description: Virtual Camp. With Unity, an industry-grade design software, aspiring game designers will learn level editing, 3D modeling, impactful gameplay creation, and how to utilize scripts and variables. Projects will be available on Black Rocket's protected website. Compatible with MAC and Windows OS only and requires a 64-bit operating system.

camps.title: World Travel in 3D (5 1/2-12 yrs.)
camps.description: Create 3D masterpieces with Abrakadoodle inspired by world cultures. Create art using a variety of materials, play games, and understand that through art we can connect with people from all over the world.

camps.title: World Cup Soccer Camp (6-14 yrs)
camps.description: At Love the Ball Soccer channels that global excitement into unforgettable summer experience. Campers won't just play soccer—they'll celebrate it through fast-paced drills, creative skill challenges, and daily scrimmages. Each week features World Cup-themed games, country flag days, and mini-tournaments that bring the international spirit to life. No camp June 19.

camps.title: World Cup Soccer Camp (6-14 yrs)
camps.description: At Love the Ball Soccer channels that global excitement into unforgettable summer experience. Campers won't just play soccer—they'll celebrate it through fast-paced drills, creative skill challenges, and daily scrimmages. Each week features World Cup-themed games, country flag days, and mini-tournaments that bring the international spirit to life. No camp June 19.

camps.title: Action Movie & Stop Motion Flix (7-13 yrs.)
camps.description: Two camps in one with Incrediflix. In the mornings, there's no limits in your action packed movie when using a green screen and camera tricks. Collaborate to write, act, and direct in this stunt packed movie where you'll be taught action choreography to thrill the audience. In the afternoon, make your own stop-motion movie using Pokémon characters. Work in small groups to storyboard, film, and voice-over your adventure.

camps.title: Art Explorers Camp (5-7 yrs.)
camps.description: Explore art mediums through craft projects, painting, drawing, beading, paper arts, and sculpting. Emphasis is on creativity, games, and the love of art.

camps.title: Art Explorers Camp (5-7 yrs.)
camps.description: Explore art mediums through craft projects, painting, drawing, beading, paper arts, and sculpting. Emphasis is on creativity, games, and the love of art.

camps.title: All About Horses Summer Camp (8-10 yrs.)
camps.description: Campers learn about tacking, grooming, general horse care, and barn chores with daily 30-minute riding lessons. Other horse-related activities include arts and crafts, equine speakers, and breed demonstrations.

camps.title: LEGO® Design: Athena's Architects (6-12 yrs)
camps.description: Campers explore architecture and engineering through LEGO® with guidance from Athena instructors. Projects include skyscrapers, pyramids, and futuristic builds.

camps.title: Flag Football (10-12 yrs)
camps.description: Experience to remember powered by Perfect Performance NFL Flag Football. Experienced coaching staff of current and former college/high school football players provide personalized instruction focusing on footwork, offensive and defensive skills, and game strategy.

camps.title: Adult Pickleball Camp (Adults)
camps.description: Pickleball is a fast-paced paddle sport that combines tennis, table tennis, and badminton. Learn the rules of the game, the basics, and practice skills. Campers will work together as a team while competing in lightly competitive tournament-style matches.

camps.title: Music Production with FL Studio Mobile (7-12yrs)
camps.description: Baroody campers turn their tablet into a personal recording studio using FL Studio Mobile. They'll learn to build drumbeats, write melodies, and structure their own songs from scratch—no prior experience needed. By the end of the week, campers will have produced their own original track, boosting creativity, technical skills, and confidence in music-making.

camps.title: Pottery Around the World (5-12 yrs)
camps.description: Travel the globe (without leaving the studio) to discover how people all over the world create amazing pottery with Mudskippers. Get your hands messy making your own clay creations inspired by different cultures. Pottery will be fired in a kiln so you'll have real, lasting artwork. At the end of camp, we'll celebrate with a special art show where you can show off your masterpieces to family and friends.

camps.title: Pottery Around the World (5-12 yrs)
camps.description: Travel the globe (without leaving the studio) to discover how people all over the world create amazing pottery with Mudskippers. Get your hands messy making your own clay creations inspired by different cultures. Pottery will be fired in a kiln so you'll have real, lasting artwork. At the end of camp, we'll celebrate with a special art show where you can show off your masterpieces to family and friends.

camps.title: Pottery & Sweets Camp (5-12 yrs)
camps.description: Mix pottery with tasty treats in this Mudskippers camp. First, hand-build your very own mini serveware—perfect for holding cookies, cupcakes, and other goodies. Then, roll up your sleeves to bake, design, and decorate delicious sweets. Your pottery will be fired in our kiln so you'll have real, functional artwork you can keep forever. At the end of camp, celebrate with a special art show.

camps.title: Ninja Obstacles & Tumbling Camp (5 1/2-12 yrs.)
camps.description: Be a ninja games warrior in this action-packed Metro Movement camp. Learn tumbling skills, jump across the floating steps and compete in our floor-based obstacle course challenge. Rec Center camps include an afternoon swim break. A signed participation release is due on the first day. No camp June 19 and July 3.

camps.title: All Sports Camp with Alpha Sports (7-11 yrs)
Explore Science & Python/Scratch Coding (6-12y)
camps.description: Spark curiosity and deepen appreciation for science through engaging and hands-on learning experiences. Stemtree curriculum empowers campers to become confident scientific thinkers by exploring the core principles of science. Campers will code in either Python or Scratch based on their grade levels. Scratch is a highly visual programming language suitable for younger students. Python is one of the most popular programming languages used in data sciences and machine learning. Previous participants will continue learning new STEM concepts.

camps.title: Virtual Chess Camp  (6-13yr)
camps.description: Silver Knights (formerly Magnus Academy) online camp featuring a mix of live lessons, practice games, puzzles, and tournaments. Campers divided by skill so everyone gets useful lessons and fair games. Everything is online, so no physical board needed. *No camp on June 19 and July 3.*

camps.title: B2R Glee Camp (7-15yrs)
camps.description: Build your performance skills and learn how to sing as part of a larger group. Receive coaching from trained vocalists to learn, record and perform popular songs. Make the most of your singing voice while learning to care for your vocal cords, control volume and pitch and refine techniques like melody and harmony.

camps.title: Basketball & Sports Camp (6-12 yrs)
camps.description: Join One on One Basketball where the focus is basketball and other team sports each day. Campers play soccer, kickball, hand ball and capture the flag. Camp will be held outdoors as much as possible. Rec Center camp locations include an afternoon swim break.

camps.title: Minecraft Modders Virtual Camp (8-11 yrs.)
camps.description: Learn scripting and logic statements to design your first mods and customize your own Minecraft world. Create new elements and gameplay mechanics. Requires Java version of Minecraft. Compatible with MAC and Windows OS only. Projects available on Black Rocket's protected website.

camps.title: Tennis Camp (6-12 yrs.)
camps.description: JST Athletics outdoor tennis instruction through drills and games to improve skills. Bring tennis racket and one can of tennis balls. Full-day camps include afternoon swim break and require swimsuit/towel daily. No camp July 3.

camps.title: Camp Summer Stomp (6-12 yrs.)
camps.description: Take a room full of creative kids, add rhythm sticks and household items and watch the magic begin. In this high-energy Rich Sandler music camp, children experience rhythm and movement in the style of the hit Broadway musical Stomp! The week culminates with a performance for family/friends. Bring a swimsuit and towel for a swim break.

camps.title: ACTion! Broadway Camp (7-14 yrs)
camps.description:
A Moonlit Wings theatre camp where young performers shine as they sing, dance, and act along to favorite show tunes and original scenes inspired by Broadway's biggest hits. Campers explore:
- Character creation
- Theatre games
- Talent show
- Building confidence, creativity, and stage presence

camps.title: Sew & Swim Camp (8-12 yrs.)
camps.description: Boys and girls will learn sewing basics including measuring, hand and machine techniques, maintenance and machine operation. Create a custom towel wrap or a waterproof swim bag. Bring a lunch, drink and swimsuit/towel (Wednesday and Friday) for afternoon swim break.

camps.title: Wildlife Rangers (6-11 yrs.)
camps.description: Join our naturalist on outdoor adventures and field studies in nature. This is for serious nature lovers who don't mind getting dirty. Campers learn outdoor survival skills such as using maps, making fires, and building shelter. Experiments, games, activities, and observation skills help us explore the many habitats in our parks. No camp June 18-19 and July 3.

camps.title: Beading & Wire Wrapping Camp (8-14 yrs)
camps.description: Unleash your creativity in this hands-on jewelry-making camp. Explore the colorful world of beads and learn the art of wire wrapping to create unique, one-of-a-kind accessories. Design and craft dazzling bracelets, artistic pendants, and other wearable masterpieces. Perfect for beginners and budding jewelry artists.

camps.title: Animal Vets Farm Camp
camps.description: Farm animals have many needs from food to medicine to the right living spaces. Practice being a vet with STEM activities and daily hands-on access to animals. Games, crafts, and activities round out this camp.

camps.title: Tumbling & Cheer Camp (5 1/2-12 yrs.)
camps.description: In this Metro Movement camp, taught by former NFL, NBA, and other trained cheerleaders and gymnasts, campers will enjoy tumbling, cheers, stunt skills, and games.

camps.title: Accotink Adventure Camp (9-13 yrs.)
camps.description: Join us for the ultimate outdoor camp that includes fishing, hiking, off road biking, animal tracking, and animal identification. Bring lunch, snack and water bottle daily. Camps run rain or shine. Contact the park for details on extreme weather days. *No camp July 3.*

camps.title: Real World Robotics (7-12yrs)
camps.description: Explore how robots help humans live in the modern world and explore other worlds with Snapology. While working with a partner, campers will learn to effectively utilize sensors, how different mechanical components work in their robots, and how programming is a challenging but rewarding skill that they can master with just a little practice.

camps.title: Teeny, Tiny Treats Art Camp (5-12 yrs)
camps.description: Sweet and creative Kidcreate camp where young artists explore a variety of art techniques while crafting adorable mini desserts including milkshake slime, clay cakes, and tiny ice cream sundaes. Hands-on adventure bursting with creativity.

camps.title: Nailed It! The Art of Cupcakes (10-14yrs)
camps.description: Take Cupcake Wars to the next level. Campers decorate cupcakes all week with animal faces, floral designs, and hamburger cupcakes. No camp July 3.

camps.title: Outdoor Living Skills: Beyond the Trail
camps.description: Embark on a thrilling journey of wilderness exploration and self-sufficiency with Baroody Camps. This immersive experience equips participants with essential skills to thrive in the great outdoors. The group will travel within about a 1-hour radius.

camps.title: B2R Rock Band Camp (7-15 yrs)
camps.description: Practice and perform as part of a real rock band on the instrument of your choice. Bands receive coaching from professional musicians to learn, record, and perform at least two songs by the end of the week. Depending on the skill level of the students, bands are encouraged to write their own songs or pick from our 400+ popular arrangements. No music experience required.

camps.title: B2R Rock Band Camp (7-15 yrs)
camps.description: Practice and perform as part of a real rock band on the instrument of your choice. Bands receive coaching from professional musicians to learn, record, and perform at least two songs by the end of the week. Depending on the skill level of the students, bands are encouraged to write their own songs or pick from our 400+ popular arrangements. No music experience required.

camps.title: All Star Gymnastics (4-7- yrs.)
camps.description: Young KinderJam gymnasts will explore basic gymnastics skills while enjoying cooperative games, arts and crafts, and outdoor play. Bring a snack, lunch, and water.

camps.title: Brazilian Soccer World Cup Camp (7-14yrs)
camps.description: Channels global excitement into unforgettable summer camp. Campers won't just play soccer—they'll celebrate it. Through fast-paced drills, creative skill challenges, and daily scrimmages, campers build confidence, teamwork, and lasting friendships. Each week features World Cup-themed games, country flag days, and mini-tournaments that bring the international spirit to life.

camps.title: Brazilian Soccer World Cup Camp (7-14yrs)
camps.description: Channels global excitement into unforgettable summer camp. Campers won't just play soccer—they'll celebrate it. Through fast-paced drills, creative skill challenges, and daily scrimmages, campers build confidence, teamwork, and lasting friendships. Each week features World Cup-themed games, country flag days, and mini-tournaments that bring the international spirit to life.

camps.title: Video Game Animation Virtual Camp (11-14 yrs.)
camps.description: Create sophisticated sprite animations using simple-to-learn techniques for any 2D editor. Squash, stretch, and shade your creations to make characters pop. No prior experience in game design, animation, or sketching required. Student-created games available on Black Rocket's password-protected website.

camps.title: Colorful Critters Pastel Camp (6-12yrs)
camps.description: Campers will learn pastel drawing and texturing techniques to illustrate whimsical bees, a fanciful army of frogs, a striking owl and more artistic critters filled with detail. Challenge your creative kids by introducing them to the world of pastels, a guaranteed favorite summer tradition for every Young Rembrandts artist.

camps.title: Spy Science: Crime Scene Investigators (7-11 yrs)
camps.description: Campers will discover forensic science and learn the tricks of the spy trade. Investigate fingerprints, spying techniques (surveillance), secret codes, invisible ink, and other sneaky science in this Baroody camp. No camp July 3.

camps.title: STEM & Jurassic Engineering with LEGO® (7-12y)
camps.description: Join a Play-Well TEKnologies instructor while exploring real-world concepts in physics, engineering, and architecture through engineer-designed projects. In this immersive LEGO®-powered STEM course, students use critical thinking to build habitats and embark on expeditions to uncover elusive species. Guided by expert instructors, students will collaborate, innovate, and bring the Jurassic world to life while deepening their understanding of biology, engineering, and prehistoric ecosystems.

camps.title: Hoops Lab: Basketball Innovation Camp (6-13yrs)
camps.description: Take basketball beyond the basics with a mix of skill development, creativity, and competition. Campers sharpen their ball handling, shooting, and defense through dynamic drills, then test themselves in "Pro Day" challenges like speed dribble courses and vertical jump testing. Each afternoon features small-sided scrimmages and 3v3 strategy. The week wraps up with a Skills Combine showcase where every player shines.

camps.title: A.I.Engineering Basics: Intro to LLM (9-14 yrs)
camps.description: Campers dive into the exciting world of generative AI, exploring the technology behind today's most powerful tools with iCODE. Throughout the week, they'll work hands-on with the latest AI models to build their own multi-modal personal assistant while unpacking key concepts like training sets, LLMs, transformers, APIs, and both supervised and unsupervised learning. Students will use programming languages such as Python and JavaScript to harness the full potential of modern AI.

camps.title: Volleyball Camp with Alpha Sports (8-12yrs)
camps.description: Learn to pass, set, and hit at Volleyball Camp with Alpha Sports. Learn the fundamentals of volleyball and participate in contests, scrimmages, and games. No camp June 19.

camps.title: Fantastic Fossils (5-8 yrs.)
camps.description: Explore the world of fossils and geology with The Science Seed. Erupt your own volcano, create and excavate a dino dig, explore real fossils, and make a cast of a real fossil. Round out the day with an outside break, a science-related story time and a daily journal entry.

camps.title: All Sports Camp with Alpha Sports (7-11 yrs)
Cooking: Kids Baking Championship (6-10y)
camps.description: Campers master muffins, tarts, cupcakes, and dessert sauces while learning key techniques. Then small teams compete in a final baking battle to claim the ultimate title: 'Baking Champion!'

camps.title: Pop Star Dance Camp (6-12 yrs.)
camps.description: Campers will dance to the hottest music and dance styles in this Envision Dance camp as they play games and do arts and crafts. Bring swimsuit/towel daily for afternoon swim break if available. Dance performance at the end of the week for family and friends. No camp July 3.

camps.title: Kiddie Camp (3-5 yrs)
camps.description: Preschoolers will enjoy a variety of activities including music, movement, arts and crafts, outdoor games, water play, and a special event.

camps.title: Summer Games (5 1/2-12 yrs)
camps.description: An action-packed Metro Movement camp featuring a pool noodle javelin toss, gymnastics skills instruction, and relay races. Bring swimsuit and towel for afternoon swim time. A signed participation release is due on the first day.

camps.title: Beginning Athletes with JST (6-12 yrs.)
camps.description: This JST camp gives campers a chance to try out a different sport every day: basketball, flag football, soccer, baseball and tennis. Rec Center camps include an afternoon swim break.

camps.title: Python/Scratch Coding & Robo Fun  (6-12y)
camps.description: Stemtree campers will code in either Python or Scratch based on their grade levels. Scratch is a highly visual programming language suitable for younger students. Python is one of the most popular programming languages used in data sciences and machine learning. Robots inspire campers to learn engineering, apply basic science, model construction, computer programming, problem-solving skills and knowledge to explore STEM concepts. Previous participants will continue learning new STEM concepts.

camps.title: Pottery & Sweets Camp (5-12 yrs)
camps.description: Mix pottery with tasty treats in this Mudskippers camp. First, hand-build your very own mini serveware—perfect for holding cookies, cupcakes, and other goodies. Then, roll up your sleeves to bake, design, and decorate delicious sweets. Your pottery will be fired in our kiln so you'll have real, functional artwork you can keep forever. At the end of camp, celebrate with a special art show.

camps.title: Pottery & Sweets Camp (5-12 yrs)
camps.description: Mix pottery with tasty treats in this Mudskippers camp. First, hand-build your very own mini serveware—perfect for holding cookies, cupcakes, and other goodies. Then, roll up your sleeves to bake, design, and decorate delicious sweets. Your pottery will be fired in our kiln so you'll have real, functional artwork you can keep forever. At the end of camp, celebrate with a special art show.

camps.title: Flag Football Camp (8-9 1/2 yrs.)
camps.description: This unique SMUV Sports camp focuses on fundamentals with drills and contests in two popular sports—baseball and flag football. Campers will enjoy game play daily. Rec Center camp includes an afternoon swim break.

camps.title: LEGO Astronaut & Dinosaur Camp (6-10 yrs.)
camps.description: Explore the solar system in our astronaut training academy with SteamKidz Lab. Use LEGO® to create space gadgets. Learn about constellations, rockets, and planetary geology. In the afternoon, put on your paleontologist hat and enter a time machine back to a lost island of dinosaurs. Study dinosaur bones, hunt for fossils, and create fossil models. Bring a lunch, snack, and drink. No camp July 3.

camps.title: Junior Lifeguard Camp (11-14 yrs)
camps.description: Learn skills and techniques used by lifeguards to help you prepare for future certification. (FCPA lifeguards receive formal training at age 15). Campers are introduced to CPR, first aid and rescue techniques.

camps.title: Junior Lifeguard Camp (11-14 yrs)
camps.description: Learn skills and techniques used by lifeguards to help you prepare for future certification. (FCPA lifeguards receive formal training at age 15). Campers are introduced to CPR, first aid and rescue techniques.

camps.title: Junior Lifeguard Camp (11-14 yrs)
camps.description: Learn skills and techniques used by lifeguards to help you prepare for future certification. (FCPA lifeguards receive formal training at age 15). Campers are introduced to CPR, first aid and rescue techniques.

camps.title: Ultimate Music Camp (5-12 yrs)
camps.description: Learn Now Music introduces campers to a variety of musical instruments and concepts including piano, guitar, violin, drums, voice, and movement. Campers participate in musical games, crafts, listening excerpts, and related projects. FREE instrument rentals are provided for in-camp use and at-home exploration (LNMG Camp Form must be signed). Instruments must be returned at the end of the week. Bring lunch, snacks, and a drink daily (no nuts).

camps.title: Ultimate Music Camp (5-12 yrs)
camps.description: Learn Now Music introduces campers to a variety of musical instruments and concepts including piano, guitar, violin, drums, voice, and movement. Campers participate in musical games, crafts, listening excerpts, and related projects. FREE instrument rentals are provided for in-camp use and at-home exploration (LNMG Camp Form must be signed). Instruments must be returned at the end of the week. Bring lunch, snacks, and a drink daily (no nuts).

camps.title: Ultimate Music Camp (5-12 yrs)
camps.description: Learn Now Music introduces campers to a variety of musical instruments and concepts including piano, guitar, violin, drums, voice, and movement. Campers participate in musical games, crafts, listening excerpts, and related projects. FREE instrument rentals are provided for in-camp use and at-home exploration (LNMG Camp Form must be signed). Instruments must be returned at the end of the week. Bring lunch, snacks, and a drink daily (no nuts).

camps.title: Roblox Nightmare Coders (9-14 yrs)
camps.description: Campers dive into the eerie side of game design as they build their own spooky adventure in Roblox Studio with iCODE instructors. They'll learn the basics of creating immersive environments by customizing haunted maps, then add interactive elements such as doors that creak open, simple puzzles, and scripted jump scares to keep players on edge. By the end of the week, each camper will have crafted their own multi-level horror experience in the classic Roblox style—complete with atmosphere, scares, and plenty of room for their imagination to shine.

camps.title: Roblox Nightmare Coders (9-14 yrs)
camps.description: Campers dive into the eerie side of game design as they build their own spooky adventure in Roblox Studio with iCODE instructors. They'll learn the basics of creating immersive environments by customizing haunted maps, then add interactive elements such as doors that creak open, simple puzzles, and scripted jump scares to keep players on edge. By the end of the week, each camper will have crafted their own multi-level horror experience in the classic Roblox style—complete with atmosphere, scares, and plenty of room for their imagination to shine.

camps.title: Explore Science & Python/Scratch Coding (6-12y)
camps.description: Spark curiosity and deepen appreciation for science through engaging and hands-on learning experiences. Stemtree curriculum empowers campers to become confident scientific thinkers by exploring the core principles of science. Campers will code in either Python or Scratch based on their grade levels. Scratch is a highly visual programming language suitable for younger students. Python is one of the most popular programming languages used in data sciences and machine learning. Previous participants will continue learning new STEM concepts.

camps.title: Chess Camp (6-13yrs)
camps.description: This Silver Knights camp has taught the great strategy game to more than 100,000 children including national champions. This camp is for advanced players to sharpen their skills or beginners who want to learn the game. Campers will learn the rules, openings, tactics, strategy, endgames, while playing games and taking outdoor breaks.

camps.title: Chess Camp (6-13yrs)
camps.description: This Silver Knights camp has taught the great strategy game to more than 100,000 children including national champions. This camp is for advanced players to sharpen their skills or beginners who want to learn the game. Campers will learn the rules, openings, tactics, strategy, endgames, while playing games and taking outdoor breaks.

camps.title: Rock City World Tour (4-7yrs)
camps.description: Learn core musical concepts, like loud and soft, fast and slow, and high and low notes through movement-based activities. Children receive hands-on experience with a variety of instruments while learning fundamental skills to prepare them for future music lessons.

camps.title: Learn to Ride a Bike (5-8yrs)
camps.description: In this half-day camp, children will build confidence as they learn to ride with or without training wheels. KinderJam instructors will guide campers through balance, braking, starting, stopping, and steering drills, plus a skills course. Campers will also enjoy interactive outdoor games when they're not riding.

camps.title: Sew Sweet: Donut & Cookie Pillow Making (8-12y)
camps.description: Boys and girls will learn basic hand and machine techniques, measuring, using patterns, fabric structure, maintenance and sewing machine operation. Design and decorate your favorite donut or cookie out of fleece to make a pillow.

camps.title: Bricking Fun LEGO® Engineering (8-12 yrs)
camps.description: Dive headfirst into the world of simple machines with Snapology. Construct, tinker, and explore the hidden mechanics that make everyday objects work. From gears and pulleys to levers and inclined planes, you'll uncover the secrets behind the LEGO® creations you love and unleash your inner engineer.

camps.title: Sewing: Fashion Design w/AI (8-12 yrs)
camps.description: Boys and girls discover how fashion design works and how clothing lines are created using AI Technology. Learn fashion sketching plus basic hand and machine techniques to create an outfit and accessories for an 18" boy or girl doll or stuffed animal. Repeat campers can create a unique tote bag.

camps.title: Creeks & Critters (6-10yrs)
camps.description: From tadpoles to turtles, water is needed for all living things. Join us for this immersive camp as we explore many features of the watershed and learn about animals that depend on it. Be prepared to get wet, do cool experiments and learn how humans affect the quality of water in our rivers and streams. Rec Center camps may include afternoon swim break.

camps.title: Baroody Pickleball Camp (7-12 yrs)
camps.description: Pickleball is a fast-paced paddle sport that combines tennis, table tennis and badminton. Learn the rules of pickleball and practice basic skills through games with Baroody camps. Campers will work as a team while competing in tournament style matches.

camps.title: Baroody Pickleball Camp (7-12 yrs)
camps.description: Pickleball is a fast-paced paddle sport that combines tennis, table tennis and badminton. Learn the rules of pickleball and practice basic skills through games with Baroody camps. Campers will work as a team while competing in tournament style matches.

camps.title: Blast Through the Past Travel Camp (9-12 yrs)
camps.description: Travel through time and space and the history of the USA to celebrate the 250th anniversary of 1776. Explore our country's history through daily historical excursions and activities throughout the area and step into the shoes of our forebearers and get a taste of history.

camps.title: Applause! Movie Musicals Mania (7-14yrs)
camps.description: In this Moonlit Wings two-week camp, kids bring Hollywood favorites from the screen to the stage. Perform in original scenes and songs inspired by musical hits like Beauty and the Beast, Frozen, Encanto and more. Explore improvisation games, character creation and a talent show while developing imagination, storytelling skills, and teamwork. All levels welcome. Family/friends enjoy a mini performance on the last day. Rec Center camps require swimsuit/towel for afternoon swim break.

camps.title: Gymnastics & Dance Camp (5 1/2-12yrs)
camps.description: In this action-packed week with Metro Movement, campers will enjoy gymnastics, rhythm-and-dance movement skills, games and activities. Gymnastics apparatus includes tumbling, inflatable floor, bars, beam, and vault. Rec Center camps include an afternoon swim break. A signed participation release is due on the first day.

camps.title: All Sports Camp with Alpha Sports (7-11 yrs)
Science Games & Survivor Camp (6-10 yr)
camps.description: It's nonstop action in this SteamKidz camp packed with races, games, and surviving on a desert island. Play Earthquake and Floor is Lava. Build and race paper airplanes. Stretch slime to the finish line. Use earth, wind, fire and water to survive on a desert island and build gadgets, explore volcanoes, create a water filter and track and identify animals.

camps.title: Academy of Magic & Balloon Sculptures (6-12y)
camps.description: Spirit Pros unlocks the secrets of magic as campers learn sleight of hand, rope restorations, and even levitation tricks. They'll twist balloons into animals, swords, and creative shapes to share with friends. The week wraps up with a magic showcase video, where every camper gets to amaze their family with what they've learned.

camps.title: Minecraft Modders & Roblox Makers (8-14yrs)
camps.description: Unlock the power of Roblox Studio, the world creation tool used by real-world Roblox developers. Learn how to build 3D models, customize characters and animations, and create your own Roblox world with Black Rocket instructors. Then, customize your own Minecraft world while learning basic coding and scripting concepts using the Java version of Minecraft. Create a wide variety of new elements, gameplay mechanics, and world generating mods to change the way you play Minecraft.

camps.title: Cooking & Crafts Camp (8-12 yrs)
camps.description: Experience history as you churn your own butter, sample historic foods, gain traditional crafting skills, and play historic games.

camps.title: Basketball & Sports Camp (6-12 yrs)
camps.description: Join One on One Basketball where the focus is basketball and other team sports each day. Campers play soccer, kickball, hand ball and capture the flag. Camp will be held outdoors as much as possible. Rec Center camp locations include an afternoon swim break.

camps.title: Nature Fun Camp (6-9yrs)
camps.description: Campers will learn about various aspects of nature through hands-on activities such as nature hikes, arts and crafts, and games. Bring a lunch, drink, swimsuit/towel for daily swim. No camp June 19 and July 3.

camps.title: ROBLOX Makers Virtual Camp (8-11yrs)
camps.description: Unlock the power of ROBLOX Studio, the world creation tool used by real-world developers. Build 3D models and create an adventure in your ROBLOX world. Design characters with unique animations. Projects available on Black Rocket's protected website. Compatible with MAC and Windows OS only.

camps.title: Ultimate Music Camp (5-12 yrs)
camps.description: Learn Now Music introduces campers to a variety of musical instruments and concepts including piano, guitar, violin, drums, voice, and movement. Campers participate in musical games, crafts, listening excerpts, and related projects. FREE instrument rentals are provided for in-camp use and at-home exploration (LNMG Camp Form must be signed). Instruments must be returned at the end of the week. Bring lunch, snacks, and a drink daily (no nuts).

camps.title: Secret Agent Lab (6-10yrs)
camps.description: Connect the dots using science to help solve a crime in this hands-on Mad Science camp. Uncover the science involved in evidence gathering, analysis, and fingerprint detection. Enhance your recall and observation skills and learn how to use spy equipment. No camp July 3.

camps.title: Baroody Sports: Volleyball Camp(6-12yr)
camps.description: This Baroody volleyball camp is the perfect way to jump into this fan-favorite sport. Players will build confidence and strength through games, drills, and plenty of touches on the ball each day. From learning fundamentals and rotations to playing out competitive points, everyone will stay engaged and improving. Open to beginners and experienced players.

camps.title: Tennis & Swim Time Camp (6-13 yrs)
camps.description: Rich Sandler camp developing fundamental tennis skills through games and activities. Bring tennis racket, snack, water bottle, lunch, and swimsuit/towel for afternoon swim break. No camp July 3.

camps.title: Lakeside Splash & Explore Camp(9-12yr)
camps.description: Campers will enjoy fishing, hiking, nature crafts, games and boating lakeside. Camp includes swim time at our famous Water Mine Family Swimmin' Hole (dependent on weather/waterpark operation). Bring a swimsuit, towel, bag lunch, snacks and water bottle. Camp runs rain or shine. No camp June 19 and July 3.

camps.title: Baseball Beginners Camp (5-6y)
camps.description: This US9 camp will introduce skills such as throwing, catching, fielding, hitting and baserunning. Camp consists of attention-grabbing, short sessions of skill-related activities using batting drills, safety balls, bean bags and targets.

camps.title: Baseball Beginners Camp (5-6y)
camps.description: This US9 camp will introduce skills such as throwing, catching, fielding, hitting and baserunning. Camp consists of attention-grabbing, short sessions of skill-related activities using batting drills, safety balls, bean bags and targets.

camps.title: Baseball Beginners Camp (5-6y)
camps.description: This US9 camp will introduce skills such as throwing, catching, fielding, hitting and baserunning. Camp consists of attention-grabbing, short sessions of skill-related activities using batting drills, safety balls, bean bags and targets.

camps.title: Amazing Acts Circus Camp (6-12 yrs)
camps.description: This Spirit Pros camp blends the excitement of circus arts with hands-on creativity. Campers will practice on a variety of circus equipment, create balloon animals and sculptures, and learn to juggle scarves, rings, balls, and clubs. From tightrope walking and stilts to balance boards, barrels, and basic acrobatics, campers will build confidence, coordination, and showmanship in a safe and supportive environment.

camps.title: Baseball Camp with US9 (7-12 yrs)
camps.description: US9 Baseball offers an instructional camp designed to teach both fundamentals and advanced skills. In addition to daily scrimmage games and trivia contests, all campers receive instruction on pitching, hitting, baserunning, fielding, game situations, rules and sportsmanship. Rec Center camps include afternoon swim break.

camps.title: Baseball Camp with US9 (7-12 yrs)
camps.description: US9 Baseball offers an instructional camp designed to teach both fundamentals and advanced skills. In addition to daily scrimmage games and trivia contests, all campers receive instruction on pitching, hitting, baserunning, fielding, game situations, rules and sportsmanship. Rec Center camps include afternoon swim break.

camps.title: Baseball Camp with US9 (7-12 yrs)
camps.description: US9 Baseball offers an instructional camp designed to teach both fundamentals and advanced skills. In addition to daily scrimmage games and trivia contests, all campers receive instruction on pitching, hitting, baserunning, fielding, game situations, rules and sportsmanship. Rec Center camps include afternoon swim break.

camps.title: Baseball Camp with US9 (7-12 yrs)
camps.description: US9 Baseball offers an instructional camp designed to teach both fundamentals and advanced skills. In addition to daily scrimmage games and trivia contests, all campers receive instruction on pitching, hitting, baserunning, fielding, game situations, rules and sportsmanship. Rec Center camps include afternoon swim break.

camps.title: Toy & Gadgets Design Lab (6-10 yrs)
camps.description: Dream up, design, and build your very own toys and games with SteamKidz Lab. Discover the science behind balance, motion, and light, then use it to create interactive masterpieces. Design, build, and add your own style and story to your creations, then finish with the Toy Expo, where you show off your inventions for everyone to see.

camps.title: Camp Colvin (8-12 yrs)
camps.description: Discover what it was like to grow up in the past. Explore history through simple recipes, heritage crafts and games. Learn weaving and metal working, bake with grain you've ground, work and play as you become a time-traveler through history.

camps.title: Build Your Own Circuit & Python/Scratch Coding
ACTivate! Teens Behind the Scenes (14-16yrs)
camps.description: In this new Moonlit Wings camp, teens join the tech track as Jr. Directors, helping lead acting activities, improv games, staging and choreography. Teens assist with basic tech like sets, costumes, lighting, and sound—building leadership and production skills. These programs are partnered with Moonlit Wings camps. ACTify camps are more production-focused with a longer show, while ACTion and Applause offer shorter performances, theatre games, and swim time at select locations.

camps.title: ACTivate! Teens Behind the Scenes (14-16yrs)
camps.description: In this new Moonlit Wings camp, teens join the tech track as Jr. Directors, helping lead acting activities, improv games, staging and choreography. Teens assist with basic tech like sets, costumes, lighting, and sound—building leadership and production skills. These programs are partnered with Moonlit Wings camps. ACTify camps are more production-focused with a longer show, while ACTion and Applause offer shorter performances, theatre games, and swim time at select locations.

camps.title: Bricking Fun LEGO® Adventures (8-12yrs)
camps.description: Snapology campers free-build using their imagination to create exciting adventures with LEGO® bricks. Then they'll bring their stories to life by sharing them with the group. From daring quests to silly comedies, it's all about creativity and building confidence while presenting your creations.

camps.title: Bulls & Bears Camp (10-13yrs)
camps.description: Learn investing fundamentals and how you can start investing at a young age with SPARK Business Academy. Build your own $100,000 stock portfolio and trade stocks like Apple, Nike or Amazon with an investing simulation tool. This hands-on experience empowers campers with the tools and mindset to face future investment decisions with confidence to buy low, sell high.

camps.title: Junior Naturalist Camp (7-13 yrs)
camps.description: Spend the week with a naturalist learning about the world around you and the various roles of a naturalist. Study the park's wildlife through data collection, research, and exploring parkland. Campers will enjoy various games and activities that will help them understand the world around them and see things in a new way.

camps.title: Junior Naturalist Camp (7-13 yrs)
camps.description: Spend the week with a naturalist learning about the world around you and the various roles of a naturalist. Study the park's wildlife through data collection, research, and exploring parkland. Campers will enjoy various games and activities that will help them understand the world around them and see things in a new way.

camps.title: Ballet Dance Camp (6-12yrs)
camps.description: Envision ballet dance camp is for campers who would like to learn or continue learning ballet. Campers will do arts and crafts, play games and learn ballet. At the end of the week campers will put on a dance performance. Bring a swimsuit and towel daily for an afternoon swim break.

camps.title: LEGO® Robotics WeDo 2.0 (5-12yrs)
camps.description: Campers will dive hands-on into building and programming robots using LEGO® WeDo kits. They'll bring to life a hopping frog, a daring rescue helicopter, or an adventurous moon rover. As they tinker and create, they'll learn the magic behind motors, hubs, and sensors, and explore computer science with concepts like sequencing, debugging, and loops.

camps.title: Multi-Sport Camp (6-12 yrs.)
camps.description: Skyhawks Athletes will learn the rules and essential skills of each sport, along with vital life lessons such as sportsmanship, inclusion and teamwork.

camps.title: Baroody Slime Time (5-12yrs)
camps.description: In this hands-on Baroody program, campers create all kinds of slime—magnetic, glittery, glow-in-the-dark, and more—while having a blast experimenting with different ingredients. Along the way, they'll learn what makes slime work, from activators to how textures change with each recipe.

camps.title: Cooking: Cupcake Wars (6-10 yrs)
camps.description: Learn to bake, frost, and decorate, then go head-to-head in a sugary showdown. Small teams compete for glory and the title of 'Best Cupcake!' in a friendly competition.

camps.title: Baroody STEM Adventures (8-11yrs)
camps.description: Join Baroody camps to delve into various aspects of STEM, exploring topics such as robotics, chemistry, coding, and game design. Our hands-on approach includes interactive experiments such as creating potions and crafting slime, as well as problem-solving activities like developing robotic contraptions.

camps.title: RoboPets Camp (4-7 yrs)
camps.description: Campers will begin to explore the world of robotics as they build moving animals that teach the fundamentals of robotic design in this Snapology camp. Learn about animal habitats, discover ways that gears and pulleys create movement while building dancing birds and robotic dogs.

camps.title: Stay Cool Ice Skating Camp (9-13 yrs)
camps.description:
Beat the heat and improve your ice-skating skills. Enjoy:
  - Daily on-ice lesson
  - Free skate time
  - On-ice games and activities
  - Off-ice activities
  
  Direct on-ice time is 1.5-2 hours. Camp includes free use of rental skates and five additional practice sessions.

camps.title: Young Adventures (7-9yr)
camps.description: Join Baroody outside for a dynamic experience tailored for kids with a passion for exploring nature and the wild. Each day offers a different adventure, including fire building, hiking, creek exploration, and climbing. Campers will be transported to various scenic spots, equipped with all necessary gear, and embark on a journey of self-discovery and skill development.

camps.title: Game Masters & Game Show Challenge (6-12y)
camps.description: Campers step into friendly contests filled with strategy, skill, and surprise with Spirit Pros. They'll rotate between live game-show challenges, classic board games, and other activities that keep the excitement fresh. With campers as the stars, the week is packed with variety, laughter, and unforgettable memories.

camps.title: Bricking Fun LEGO® Creativity (8-12yrs)
camps.description: Snapology campers work together to build amazing creations using teamwork, imagination, and tons of LEGO® bricks. There are no step-by-step rules—every team's build will be one-of-a-kind.

camps.title: Tennis with JST (6-12 yrs)
camps.description: JST Athletics outdoor tennis instruction through drills and games to improve skills. Bring tennis racket and one can of tennis balls. Full-day camps include afternoon swim break and require swimsuit/towel daily. No camp July 3.

camps.title: Tennis with JST (6-12 yrs)
camps.description: JST Athletics outdoor tennis instruction through drills and games to improve skills. Bring tennis racket and one can of tennis balls. Full-day camps include afternoon swim break and require swimsuit/towel daily. No camp July 3.

camps.title: Basketball Summer Hoops Camp(6-12yrs)
camps.description: One on One has been running camps for over 25 years and features real-game action. Campers of all skill levels will participate in drills and contests before daily game play. Participants are divided by age and ability. The week concludes with Championship Friday. Rec Center camps include an afternoon swim break.

camps.title: Live Action & LEGO® Stop Motion Flix (7-13 yrs)
camps.description: Two camps in one with Incrediflix. In the mornings, discover your filmmaking talents. You don't have to be an actor—staff will guide you through the Hollywood process to create, direct, film, act, and more. In the afternoon, work in groups to create a LEGO® set with LEGO® characters for a stop-motion movie you'll storyboard, shoot, and add voice-over. *No camp July 3.*

camps.title: Volleyball Camp with Alpha Sports (8-12yrs)
camps.description: Learn to pass, set, and hit at Volleyball Camp with Alpha Sports. Learn the fundamentals of volleyball and participate in contests, scrimmages, and games. No camp June 19.

camps.title: LEGO® Films Stop Action & Virtual Reality (8-14y)
camps.description: Join Black Rocket to create your own Virtual Reality game that can be played on a smart phone or VR headset. Make custom models and design dynamic in-game interactions to create the VR world of your dreams. Then, let your imagination take control as you create your own stop motion movie using LEGO and crafting materials. Work with a team or independently to create short films to share with friends and family. Campers may bring their own labeled figures to include in their movies or use provided materials.

camps.title: STEM & Minecraft with LEGO® Materials (5-10yrs)
camps.description: Build projects inspired by cool machines while applying real-world concepts in physics, engineering, and architecture. Venture into the world of Minecraft in Play-Well TEKnologies' unique LEGO® experience. Build your base, craft your tools, use your Minecart to harvest raw resources, and battle to stop the Ender Dragon from ending the world.

camps.title: Archery & Fencing: Battle Camp(8-14yr)
camps.description: Campers split their time between archery, fencing, and traditional camp games. Talented instructors teach archery using USA Archery's Explore Archery program. Experienced fencing coaches teach core foundational skills including advance, retreat, thrust, and lunge. The week concludes with a Robin Hood Team Tournament featuring fencing and archery competitions using electric fencing equipment.

camps.title: Foundational Soccer Skills Camp (6-12yrs)
camps.description: Challenger Sports team of international and US-based staff helps improve campers' technical foundational skills while providing a unique cultural experience. Rooted in British training methodology, this curriculum and coaching foundation meets engaging delivery for an all-around positive experience. Soccer ball and Jersey included. Sign up to host a coach and receive a free week on camp.

camps.title: Python Programmers Virtual Camp(8-11 yrs.)
camps.description: Learn the world's fastest-growing programming language favored by Google, NASA, YouTube, and the CIA. Discover how to code with Python to create engaging apps and games. Step-by-step lessons on a programming path. Compatible with MAC, Windows, and Chrome OS.

camps.title: STEM & Jurassic Engineering with LEGO® (7-12y)
camps.description: Join a Play-Well TEKnologies instructor while exploring real-world concepts in physics, engineering, and architecture through engineer-designed projects. In this immersive LEGO®-powered STEM course, students use critical thinking to build habitats and embark on expeditions to uncover elusive species. Guided by expert instructors, students will collaborate, innovate, and bring the Jurassic world to life while deepening their understanding of biology, engineering, and prehistoric ecosystems.

camps.title: NASA Space Discovery (6-10 yrs)
camps.description: SciGenie campers blast off into the wonders of space through hands-on experiments, creative projects and challenges. From exploring planets and stars to building space-inspired models, kids will discover the science behind our universe while sparking their curiosity and imagination.

camps.title: Softball Camp with US9 (7-13yrs)
camps.description: US9 Softball instructional camp teaching fundamentals and advanced skills. Includes daily scrimmage games, trivia contests, and instruction on pitching, hitting, baserunning, fielding, game situations, rules, and sportsmanship. Groups and teams created by age and/or experience to build confidence. No camp June 19 and July 3.

camps.title: RoboCreators: Engineering Adventures (6-12 yrs)
camps.description: This hands-on robotics camp with Athena uses LEGO® WeDo. Campers build robots, learn how to use gears and sensors, and design obstacle courses.

camps.title: Soccer & Games Camp (6-12yrs)
camps.description: SMUV Sports camp where campers build soccer skills while participating in other games including capture the flag, kickball, and flag tag. Includes afternoon swim break. Bring swimsuit and towel.

camps.title: Live Action & LEGO® Stop Motion Flix (7-13 yrs)
camps.description: Two camps in one with Incrediflix. In the mornings, discover your filmmaking talents. You don't have to be an actor—staff will guide you through the Hollywood process to create, direct, film, act, and more. In the afternoon, work in groups to create a LEGO® set with LEGO® characters for a stop-motion movie you'll storyboard, shoot, and add voice-over. *No camp July 3.*

camps.title: Nature’s Scientists Camp (9-12yrs)
camps.description: Future scientists will explore the world of lab experiments, hands-on fieldwork, wildlife observations, and outdoor adventures. Investigate the waterways and landscapes of Hidden Pond by testing out your hypotheses and following the scientific method.

camps.title: Baroody Soccer Camp (6-12 yrs.)
camps.description: Baroody camp featuring games using soccer skills that progress to small-sided soccer. Activities include dribbling, ball control, passing, shooting, and 1-on-1 skills with team participation. No camp June 19 or July 3.

camps.title: Glow-tastic Art Camp (5-12 yrs)
camps.description: Every project in this Kidcreate camp will glow-in-the-dark, making it as exciting in the dark as it is in the light. Using a mix of clay, paint, and other luminescent materials, campers will create dazzling masterpieces.

camps.title: K-Pop Demon Dance Hunters Camp (5 1/2-12yrs)
camps.description: Learn K-Pop routines, create your own hero characters, and use the power of music and movement to chase away the "demons" of chaos in this Metro Movement Camp. Rec Center camps include an afternoon swim break. A signed participation release is due on the first day.

camps.title: Slimes and Concoctions (6-10 yrs.)
camps.description: Explore chemistry with slime-making and potion-concocting. In the morning, investigate magnetism and diffusion plus test crazy, sticky, foamy, sparkly, fluorescing and otherwise unidentifiable slimes. In the afternoon, make wild and wacky concoctions like exploding lava, grow crystals, and a lava lamp. Through Steam Kidz Lab hands-on investigation, discover chemical and physical changes, reactions, and neutralization. Bring lunch, snack, and drink daily. No camp July 3.

camps.title: All Sports Camp with Alpha Sports (7-11 yrs)
Minecraft Modders Virtual Camp (11-14 yrs.)
camps.description: Learn scripting and logic statements to design your first mods and customize your own Minecraft world. Create new elements and gameplay mechanics. Requires Java version of Minecraft. Compatible with MAC and Windows OS only. Projects available on Black Rocket's protected website.

camps.title: 3D Game Design with Unity (11-14 yrs.)
camps.description: Virtual Camp. With Unity, an industry-grade design software, aspiring game designers will learn level editing, 3D modeling, impactful gameplay creation, and how to utilize scripts and variables. Projects will be available on Black Rocket's protected website. Compatible with MAC and Windows OS only and requires a 64-bit operating system.

camps.title: Cooking: Chopped! (10-14yrs)
camps.description: Create dishes for every meal of the day, then face a surprise twist with secret ingredients. This fast-paced camp is full of creativity as chefs think on their feet to avoid getting "chopped!"

camps.title: Cooking: Chopped! (10-14yrs)
camps.description: Create dishes for every meal of the day, then face a surprise twist with secret ingredients. This fast-paced camp is full of creativity as chefs think on their feet to avoid getting "chopped!"

camps.title: Hoops Lab: Basketball Innovation Camp (6-13yrs)
camps.description: Take basketball beyond the basics with a mix of skill development, creativity, and competition. Campers sharpen their ball handling, shooting, and defense through dynamic drills, then test themselves in "Pro Day" challenges like speed dribble courses and vertical jump testing. Each afternoon features small-sided scrimmages and 3v3 strategy. The week wraps up with a Skills Combine showcase where every player shines.

camps.title: Amusement Park Engineers (7-12yrs)
camps.description: In this Snapology camp, campers become an engineer of their own amusement park ride and learn the core physics and engineering concepts used to make a ride thrilling.

camps.title: Gamer Adventures (6-12 yrs.)
camps.description: Learn the fundamentals of programming, art and level design to create a video game from the ground up. Using a game engine with integrated art software and an easy-to-use events system, Stem exCEL have the freedom to create a product that is truly their own. Learn about the history of video games by playing classic ones to see the advancement of technology. Campers leave with a digital copy of their work.

camps.title: Sewing: Fashion Design w/AI (8-12 yrs)
camps.description: Boys and girls discover how fashion design works and how clothing lines are created using AI Technology. Learn fashion sketching plus basic hand and machine techniques to create an outfit and accessories for an 18" boy or girl doll or stuffed animal. Repeat campers can create a unique tote bag.

camps.title: Native American Survival Skills Camp (5-9 yrs.)
camps.description: Discover what daily life was like for the Eastern Woodland American Indians. From animal tracking to shelter building, children learn survival skills through outdoor activities and games. Camp focuses on the culture and lives of the Powhatan. Some sites include tool making and a cookout on the last day.

camps.title: Super Scientist (5-7 yrs.)
camps.description: Come create some crazy chemical concoctions. Projects encourage self-exploration into the science world. Please bring a lunch, snack and a drink.

camps.title: Gymnastics Camp (5 1/2-12 yrs.)
camps.description: Campers will flip head over heels in this Metro Movement gymnastics camp. Build skills and learn to master the balance beam, bars, floor and vault. Rec Center camps include an afternoon swim break. A signed participation release is due on the first day. No camp July 3.

camps.title: Minecraft Redstone Engineers Virtual Camp 11-14
camps.description: Take the next step beyond playing Minecraft and become a true Redstone engineer. Construct your own carnival with mini-games, roller coasters, and attractions powered by Redstone. Learn to use Command and Structure blocks. Requires Java version of Minecraft. Compatible with MAC and Windows OS only.

camps.title: Adventures on the Farm (6-10 yrs)
camps.description: Katydid camp where campers spend the morning on the farm with visits to animals, hikes, games, and crafts. Afternoon activities include learning about lives 100 years ago through toys, games, crafts, and pictures.

camps.title: Action Movie & Stop Motion Flix (7-13 yrs.)
camps.description: Two camps in one with Incrediflix. In the mornings, there's no limits in your action packed movie when using a green screen and camera tricks. Collaborate to write, act, and direct in this stunt packed movie where you'll be taught action choreography to thrill the audience. In the afternoon, make your own stop-motion movie using Pokémon characters. Work in small groups to storyboard, film, and voice-over your adventure.

camps.title: Animals: Zoology Fun for Kids (6-11 yrs.)
camps.description: Explore the woods, creeks and ponds as we look for all sorts of critters. Learn about the animal life science of frogs, toads, birds, mammals, snakes, turtles, fish and insects through hikes, projects and games. *No camp June 19.*

camps.title: Total Sports Camp (6-13 yrs.)
camps.description: Rich Sandler fast-paced, high-energy camp featuring a variety of sports including basketball, flag football, soccer, and track. Appropriate for boys and girls of all skill and experience levels. Includes daily swim break. No camp June 19 or July 3.

camps.title: Animation Creation: Explore Digital Tools (9-14y)
camps.description: Inspired by Pixar, Disney, and DreamWorks, this iCODE camp gives campers a behind-the-scenes look at how top studios bring stories to life. They'll explore industry methods and apply them to create their own original animations, blending creativity with hands-on digital design skills.

camps.title: All-American Girl: Living Dolls Camp (5-8yrs)
camps.description: Pack up your favorite doll and experience the life of an American girl growing up in different eras in history. Bring these times to life with your doll through activities, costumes, crafts and themed games in a beautiful historic setting.

camps.title: Archery Camp at Bull Run (9-15 yrs.)
camps.description: An indoor 3-day camp where campers develop archery skills using Olympic-style (recurve) bows. Focused instruction teaches patience, focus, and attention to detail. Additional archery-related activities provide a broader introduction. Equipment is provided. Bring a snack and drink.

camps.title: eSports & Games Camp (8-13 yrs)
camps.description: Campers will play a variety of eSports options on multiple gaming systems (e.g., Super Smash Bros., Mario Kart, Mario Party, NBA 2K, Madden, Rocket League). There will be time for free play, tournaments, and learning strategy. Campers will also learn other games including shuffleboard, foosball, air hockey, pool, cornhole, bocce ball. We will emphasize fair play, sportsmanship, and team play. Swim time included.

camps.title: Kids on Canvas (5 1/2-12 yrs)
camps.description: Use paints to explore traditional painting subjects such as figure, landscape, and still life – with a fresh Abrakadoodle twist – while learning about a variety of artists.

camps.title: Kids on Canvas (5 1/2-12 yrs)
camps.description: Use paints to explore traditional painting subjects such as figure, landscape, and still life – with a fresh Abrakadoodle twist – while learning about a variety of artists.

camps.title: Kids on Canvas (5 1/2-12 yrs)
camps.description: Use paints to explore traditional painting subjects such as figure, landscape, and still life – with a fresh Abrakadoodle twist – while learning about a variety of artists.

camps.title: Humans Inside & Out (5-8 yrs.)
camps.description: Learn all about humans with The Science Seed staff. Campers will explore our senses, skin, body systems and organs. Discover why we have bones and what the nervous system does. Find out how germs get inside the body. Other activities include outdoor recess, a science-related story time and a daily journal entry.

camps.title: Bricking Fun LEGO® Robotics Jr (5-8 yrs)
camps.description: In this exciting Snapology robotics workshop, campers build a Rover Bot that responds to color and a Surgeon Bot that can be controlled using buttons. They'll learn the fundamentals of robotic movement, sensing, and programming as they bring their creations to life.

camps.title: Allegro Song & Voice Camp (6-12 yrs)
camps.description: In this high energy Rich Sandler song and voice camp, campers learn vocal techniques, tell stories through up-tempo songs and games and create an interactive choir performance. Rec Center camps include a swim break.

camps.title: Total Rock Band Camp (6-12 yrs.)
camps.description: Rich Sandler campers will learn to play music together in a rock band format, taking turns experiencing multiple instruments, including guitars and percussion. Perform new and familiar pieces using provided instruments or bring your own. Great for all proficiency levels.

camps.title: Lakeside Splash & Explore Camp (6-9 yrs.)
camps.description: Campers will enjoy fishing, hiking, nature crafts, games and boating lakeside.
